text:
Sashimi Salad: OVERPRICED & UNDERWHELMING!!!  I love Sashimi salads and have enjoyed many good ones in many sushi different restaurants. Since I am in town from So. Cal on business and wanted to grab a quick, healthy and light lunch between appointments I decided to Yelp Japanese restaurants in my vicinity. I was delighted to see Hanabi was close by and had a 4.5* rating by 150+ people. When I arrived at the restaurant at 12:30 pm, the peak of lunch hour, on a Wednesday I thought it was odd that a restaurant so highly rated was nearly empty except for one other table. 
 After I ordered and my sashimi salad arrived I understood why the place was so empty. 
Most sashimi salads I've had are made with healthy rich greens and other vegetables and a pretty decent amount of sashimi  making for a colorful, healthy and satisfying meal. The size of these salads are usually served in plates about 8-10" in diameter. The sashimi salad at Hanabi was made up of a small amount of ice berg lettuce, one strand of pickled carrot, a small clump of white shredded radish with about 6 small pieces of sashimi served on a small rectangular plate approx 4"x6". The cost of this sad salad was $15, the same as what I have paid in other restaurants where I got a lot more. After my experience at Hanabi I find their ratings and review very suspect. I know it was just one item on their menu but the fact that no other customer came in by the time I left really makes me question the reviews. Sorry no offense to those who have submitted good reviews. Glad you had a good experience but I definitely was disappointed, left hungry and very dissatisfied.
One of the best sushi restaurants I've dined at in a long time. Would recommend this place to others in a heart beat who are looking for good sushi and rolls!

This place is a gem. The fish is always fresh and the owner is always here checking on the customers personally. He is one of the nicest restaurant owners and people you will ever meet. There is an all you can eat option and a la carte. They have very high end fish and Kobe beef as well as more entry level priced options. If you are craving some exotic fish he will order it in for you. We have been here 5 times now and it never disappoints.

All u can eat is not all u can eat , there are some items in menu have additional charge , besides that , we being told by one of waitress " do u know leftover would be charge " of course, we do know these rules!  We also get charged a piece of green cheese cake which for my daught
Service is very friendly and food is great especially yellowtail collar, yum yum .  My kids like it and so do I :).  Price is decent and also have specials going on...love it.

The sushi tasted very fresh and the service was delightful.
The luncheon special offered numerous options and we left completely satisfied.
Awesome sushi for all-you-can-eat... Great value.  Remember that sushi quality for all-you-can-eat will always be an issue, but this place is pretty good...

Perfect little quick all-you-can eat sushi place in Summerlin. If you're craving sushi and have an appetite, this is your place. Octopus poke is great and I would definitely recommend it. Service is usually pretty good as well, even when they get really busy.
This is my favorite sushi restaurant in Vegas. All you can eat is moderately priced and the service is excellent. I come here whenever I can
Appetizers were good. Sushi was OK. Desert was gross. Much better sushi available in the Valley for the price. Recommend the butter grilled mushrooms and tempura.

The Fish, fresh; just came in Halibut!
We were treated with a few chef's specials grace Ã  Chef Chris; great guy. An overall delicious experience. Close to home. Will b back, soon.

Fantastic sushi, the rolls were terrific and the service was excellent. We were down from Alaska for vacation and are very picky when it comes to seafood. That said I would recommend this place to anyone

The food and service were magnificent.  They made us rolls that weren't on the menu.  The blue fin from Spain was unbelievable. The lamb ribs made Japanese style was unreal. Keep up the great food and service Chef Andy.

FANTASTIC sushi.

Probably my favorite place for sushi in the Summerlin area. I've tried them all. As other places tend to lose quality over time, Hanabi has stayed consistent. 

I first came with a large party with coworkers, and the owner was very friendly, hospitable, and available for our questions. The food was so fresh, we couldn't stop eating. They were also very accommodating for vegetarian dietary preferences for some of our group. 

Since then, I've come multiple times and always had a great time. Service has been friendly and fast, and the food has always been perfect. 

Can't wait to go again.

This is probably the best sushi ever, if you talking customer satisfaction, this is the best service ever. Owner Andy, are always smile and humble. Foods are always fresh, price are good and don't forget to try the desert. They have a special desert.

My boyfriend and I craved good sushi and found Hanabi on Yelp. We went in and were greeted by waiters and the main chef. We ordered off the all you can eat sushi menu and tried many types of sushi recommended by the chef.  I am very sensitive about the freshness and taste of sushi because I have been to several good sushi restaurants in Japan and the US. 

They satisfied me with not just tastes but also with the quality of the sushi. I recommend you all to try out the udon at the end of eating sushi and have the honey toast for dessert!
Still love this place. Yummy, great food, great people! !!!! Amazing everything. It was my birthday and I could have picked anywhere in Vegas and still picked Hanabi
Love love love the Spicy California roll and the teriyaki chicken with miso soup. Always have wonderful service from Jiwon

What part of this authentic and welcoming sushi restaurant isn't a sushi lovers dream?! Location perfect..atmosphere clean and relaxing... sake choices endless ...owner friendly, knowledgeable and takes pride in what he is presenting to the customer..of course THE SUSHI AMAZING! salmon the best!!..I thank you and your staff for a great authentic sushi experience!

A solid 3 stars. The service wasn't good but the food was pretty good. We usually go to Koma for AYCE so this was slightly different. But it was pretty decent! I love that you can order half rolls for the AYCE and there was a lot of good rolls. We live pretty close to there so it was this place is definitely a good second option.
The best sushi ever totally worth it and far superior to any sushi I have had anywhere in Las Vegas this is more of a LA place high quality good price and I highly reccomed it

This is a great place to get Sushi, The waiters are fast and friendly and so is the chef, take care ordering they can have trouble understanding you and vise versa. but I highly recommend this place the bathroom is very clean and so is the restaurant.
Coming to Hanabi was a unique experience, the food was excellent and the service was excellent I would recommend eating here to anyone.

Hands down the best! The sushi is high quality, well prepared, and delicious. Have to say I have never had sushi come that fast and the service was great. The all you can eat deal is unbeatable! I will be coming back the next time I'm in Vegas.
Very friendly service. All you can eat is reasonably priced. Spicy tuna roll is just a little too spicy
This is my favorite sushi place in Summerlin. Always fresh and the customer service is great!

Went in for the first time. Servers and chefs were friendly. Sushi tastes fresh and flavorful. 
Will return in the future to try the AYCE! 
Happy Hour has great prices also!

Ordered a salmon hand roll which I couldn't eat let alone chew it. The salmon smelled bad and was dark, greasy and unchewable..sent it back regret not taking a picture..tried the yellow tail collar not much better, the dipping sauce bland..the upside my husband ordered Yaki Udon/soba with beef..delish..I ordered the same but with vegetables good..

My family and I went to Hanabi and it was pretty fantastic. The sushi was great/fresh and there wasn't a lack of options. 

There were even a few new rolls that I've never heard of like the Coco Shrimp Roll (I believe that's what it's called). 

The Coco Shrimp Roll was super creative (in my opinion), and I would've never thought of having coconut shrimp in a sushi roll (it was a great combination by the way).

The waitress was really nice too. She was really helpful on informing my family and I about the menu. 

Plus the honey toast and green tea ice cream mochi was really awesome.

The only reason this was a four instead of a five star was because a few dishes were just 'okay' in a sense. The sushi, sweets, and service was amazing. But just a FEW of the dishes (hot dishes) were 'okay' nothing too outstanding about them.

But either way 4/5 would go again.
The food was great, and the staff was extra friendly! It has established itself as my new sushi spot - AYCE or otherwise.
My new favorite restaurant . Fresh & delicious rolls. Great wine, beer & sake list. They even serve a5 Wagyu!!!! Chef Andy & team are truly talented & friendly

They have extended the Oct. Promotion $19.99 to  Nov. for all you can eat. There are couple of items you should try. Shrimp tempura, softshell crab, rock n roll, oyster, sashimi , tuna poke, samon roe, enoki mushroom...
The food quality, service is worth for $20

Hanabi is hands down one of the best places I've gone to for sushi. Their AYCE is pricier than most other places but it's worth it. Their super white tuna cannot be competed with, I'm surprised it's part of their AYCE. All of their sushi taste so fresh and their employees are very nice and funny. Can take and give a joke, would definitely recommend to everyone and anyone whether or not you've had sushi before.

I went to this place last night with my wife. Brand new sushi restaurant. Nice benches and tables. I liked the simple and modern atmosphere. Cheves and servers are very kind and friendly. Also the foods are great. We had all you can eat and the quality of fishes was the best . Appitizers were yummy too. If you want AYCE with the high quality fishes, visit this restaurant. You won't regret.
It was fresh and yummy but many things need to be order 'A la carte' i think they need only all you can eat menu. That makes my feel not good.

I just got the all you can eat dinner at Hanabi and was so impressed by the quality of foods and excellency of service. Usually, I am not a fan of all you can eat thing due to unpleasant experience; however, it was quite different at Hanabi. I am pretty sure Hanabi will be my main sushi restaurant in Las Vegas.

We tried the steak, chicken, and shrimp hibachi and had it delivered by Uber Eats. It was a very  small portion, with white rice and not the delicious fried variety other places offer. The first thing we noted was it smelled a bit burnt. There was a sour taste that we could only identify as lemon after biting into a few seeds.  The meats were overcooked and everyone, even my 7 and 9 year old children, were hungry after finishing this less than stellar meal. The only bright spot was the miso soup, that was delicious. Don't think we will be back for seconds, even though they leave you with plenty of room for them!
My new go to sushi place. The blue fin tuna was delicious! The miso soup also tasted authentic

My new favorite sushi place in town. I've been to many sushi places in las vegas and I finally found decent place for AYCE SUSHI.  So many food to choose from and fast and friendly service. Thx to owner  Andy and crews.

I'm new to Las Vegas and a friend recommended this place. Last night a friend and I decided to check it out, and it was one of the best sushi experiences I've had in awhile. The staff was beyond friendly and Andy, the owner, was so delightful! We tried the White House roll, Baked Salmon, Coco Shrimp, Softshell Crab, Poke Tuna, and Oysters. This menu was definitely worth it for the AYCE price. The quality of the food was excellent, even better than most places in San Diego! I'm definitely coming back here.

Awesome place in summerlin village square. Sushi chefs are social and make off menu items. Dessert is good as well. No tempura ice cream but they have green tea cheese cake mochi and honey brick toast!

I'm so happy we have a local sushi restaurant, in Summerlin!!!HANABI was absolutely delicious! Great rolls, sashimi and sushi. Service is awesome and you will leave satisfied! The fish is fresh and selections are numerous! I also loved the appetizers. There is AYCE (all you can eat) and a la carte. The place is inviting and as a true sports fan I love that u can watch it on numerous big screens.
Food was great and so was the service. Loved the korean bbq roll. Left the place with a full and happy belly!

The best all-you-can eat you can ever hope for. 

Quality:
I would say the  quality of sushi is even superior than most non-all-you-can eat restaurants. I basically tried every single menu, including white tuna, yellowtail, scallops, albacore, salmon, various rolls. Every single item was fresh and melted in my mouth.  Literally, it was the quality that you could taste. 

 Service:
Service was excellent. Before I finish my plates, my new  orders would arrive. The chiefs and serving staff were friendly and attentive. 

I plan to come back again before i return back to California.

Highly recommended!
Love this place. Spicy edamame is always a must for me. I order delivery all the time and its always fast and fresh. Great food even better price.

Perfect!! Beautiful atmosphere and the best quality ingredients I've had anywhere! Presentation was perfect and the selections were unbelievable. Hesitant to do the all you can eat because of experiences elsewhere. You can get a full spectrum of meals for your dining experience at this location. My only disappointment was finding out that I missed out on 3 months of dining here. Great Job To Andy and his staff!

From the first time I ate here during the grand opening to now, Hanabi has been my favorite sushi place. It's cozy and the staff are nice and helpful. The food is delicious as well. I highly recommend them!

Hanabi is a welcome addition to my neighborhood. I'm not much for AYCE since I'm not a big eater, but I have tried the a la carte menu several times and have been impressed every single time. The fish is fresh with a reasonable portion and the amount of rice is perfect. The menu is extensive and the only struggle is trying to narrow down what I want. The pricing for a la carte is in line with Summerlin, and I realize I *could* drive a few blocks and find something cheaper, but the food is good enough that I don't feel the need to. They also have a variety of specials if you're on a budget. But the thing I like most about this place and what keeps me coming back is the service. The staff are friendly and go above and beyond to make you feel valued. Vegas is saturated with sushi places, and many are just as good as each other. What sets a place apart is the service, and Hanabi gets 6 stars for that. It's the kind of business I want support even if it costs an extra dollar or two.
So good the soft shell crab tempura is the bomb!!! Good atmosphere and friendly staff.

BEST sushi in town! The sushi will speak for itself!! The menu is extensive and the sushi is to die for! The restaurant has a traditional atmosphere with a modern edge. Great place to watch sports on the flat screen tvs and enjoy all you can drink with your sushi! My personal favorite things to order are the crispy rice with spicy tuna, the spicy tuna hand rolls, and any type of their traditional sushi.
I come here all the time!!! The food is amazing!!! This is my go to sushi spot everyday even on quick lunch breaks!

Honestly, some of the rolls are ok. The salmon cheese stick was pretty good...but they just use cream cheese instead of a different cheese. The service isn't that good. The beef in the BBQ roll was disgusting...it literally was all fat. I took out the meat and didn't eat it. The green tea  cheesecake was frozen....I've never had cheesecake that was frozen. :/
I would not recommend it. I would recommend Oyshi. I'm not coming back here.
Bought a groupon and had a great experience. The service was wonderful, and the food was delicious. I recommend the Hanabi specialty roll. We will definitely be returning!

This place is awesome!!!! Menu is great so much to choose from. I love how this place has so many option not a typical sushi place. You can eat all you can eat and not only eat sushi but eat entrees like fried rice and soups. All the food is made fresh to order. The service is great! I love yama sushi but this place beats it cause again the food is fresh and service is great. I was very impressed with meeting the owner as he was walking around meeting his customers and getting feed back. Now that's great to see as he takes interest with what the customers has to say. You don't see that in alot of place. Andy's pretty cool to talk to, his humble, and very down to earth. Their quality of sushi is very different, you can taste the difference. And that difference is that there quality is fresh. Trust and believe me when I say Andy is a proud chef and did explain he like everything fresh and clean. Here at Hanabi you can taste the freshness and how exotic there sushi is. It will leave a taste on your taste buds wanting more. I highly recommend this place to all the sushi lovers!!!!

The customer service at this restaurant is AMAZING.  For starters I'd recommend the fried garlic chicken ( superb for garlic lovers! ) jalapeÃ±o poppers and the pork belly roll.  We ordered oysters, yellowtail , green muscles , Alaskan king crab, and Toro which was all fantastic! The Sharaku sake was extremely smooth and sweet. My only complaint is that there isn't  6 stars to give to this place!!!
The owner, Andy came and talked to my table and was very friendly. It is a pretty reasonably priced AYCE, especially for the quality of sushi you get. The honey toast desert is delicious.

I absolutely LOVE Hanabi! I've had excellent service every visit and the quality has remained top notch. Unlike some other locations I've never had rude servers nor have I been neglected service when busy. The owner has gone out of his way to ensure my food was well prepared and I was properly attended to. Highly recommend!
Great sushi! I have never been into the restaurant as I've always ordered delivery. The seaweed salad is delicious, and I love the jalapeno poppers, too. Every roll I've gotten was excellent.

Very nice restaurant. Food was fantastic. Forgot to take pictures of a lot of the items but everything i had was awesome. Everything from sushi to hot food from the kitchen was excellent. Highly recommend this spot.

Hanabi has become my new spot for sushi! I go here all the time now great sushi and staff! The owner was in yesterday and was going all around asking everyone about the place. Salmon and white tuna by far best nigiri

Undoubtedly the best sushi I have had in Vegas for many years! With the coming and going of so many sushi places on the west side, it was a real treat to find Hanabi. It was recommended by a friend, and has become one of my regular stops when choosing a place to dine out. The menu has a wide range of appetizers and rolls, some unlike other standard joints. My favorite has become the Coco Salmon roll. Coconut shrimp tempura, cream cheese and cucumber wrapped up in sushi rice and seaweed. They top it with fresh salmon sashimi and that wonderful spicy Japanese mayo. Finally it is topped off with shredded coconut. Can't get enough of this one! The staff is beyond friendly and Andy, the owner takes his time to greet all the customers and take personal pride in the dishes being served. He, himself, was Nobu trained. Any sushi lover knows the quality that entails. Don't forget to try something different here, like the seared pork belly appetizer, or the honey toast dessert. Your palette will thank you over and over again. They stay open until 11pm, so not really too much of a late-night spot, but perfect when you get the craving for quality sushi for lunch, dinner or that late dinner when you're too busy doing other things and don't get the chance to eat until 9pm!
Service with a smile. Andy special, hamachi, shrimp tempura, crispy buffalo shrimp, oysters are all good choices!! Our favorite sushi place.

The sushi is very good. Fresh. Okay portions. Nigiri however is paper thin for ayce. The problem is the 20 min + wait between food (more like 30- just being conservative), even when you order promptly and there are two other tables. It HAS to be taking this long on purpose. I have never had to wait so long at ayce for little orders. Not coming back.

This was our first time dining at this restaurant. We decided upon this place based on what we had read on yelp. Upon entering, the owner greeted us at our table and introduced himself to us. He set the bar for our meal very high. Unfortunately, that's where it ended.  Although The food came out VERY quickly, it was your average run of the mill sushi.  Very plain and bland tasting fish. We found ourselves using lots of soy sauce and wasabi in efforts to add flavor to the fish. Be warned, if you prefer soy paper to seaweed, be prepared to pay an extra $1.00 per roll. As the meal went on, we saw less and less of our server. 

There's enough good sushi bars offering AYCE that we have no reason to go back

Holy crap this place is amazing!! My fiancÃ© and I tried this place out on a date night, and the food came SO fast! We LOVED the food, and there wasn't any roll we didn't like! It also helped that they have a $20 AYCE special going on through October. Their dessert is awesome too. If you go here you HAVE try is the green tea cheesecake!!

Best sushi restaurant in the Northwest Summerlin area. The sushi is super fresh, tastes great and is attractively presented. The servers are very friendly and helpful. An added bonus is AYCE discounted price for October. A neighborhood favorite and will be a regular customer. 

Updated Review:  I have been a regular visitor to Hanabi, and my thoughts about this hidden gem have not changed. The personable owner, Andy, always welcomes and greets the customers and makes sure everything is fine.  The quality and presentation of the food is top notch. The staff is very friendly and attentive. If you're in the neighborhood, stop in for a meal.  You'll be glad you did.  But P.S. Don't forget the green tea ice cream. It's the real deal!l

Update 07/27/17

Hey Summerlin Residents. I've been a regular customer at Hanabi for over a year and I have to say the sushi is still super fresh and of high quality. 

The owner, Andy, still takes time to greet all of the customers and is a very friendly guy, as is his entire staff. The restaurant has been updated with the addition of chairs to the wooden benches, making for a comfortable and pleasant dining experience. 

As an added bonus, Hanabi is celebrating its second anniversary with some drink promotions, including buy 1, get 1 House sake and buy 2 beers  and get one free. 

This hidden gem in Summerlin is definitely worth the trip for anyone who likes sushi. There are also many cooked dishes for those not as adventurous. 

Trust me, once you try the food, you will return. Enjoy!
Solid spot for AYCE. Not mind blowing. The fish was ok (too much rice). Enjoyed the appetizers the most.

Dined on a Saturday evening and this place was dead with only one table occupied. Came based on the very positive reviews and location at Village Square on Sahara is near home.

Service was attentive but wouldn't categorize it as warm and friendly.  We didn't get water refills until the end of the meal and when we finally asked.  Food came out quickly - hot foods hot.

Adults got the AYCE option. Kids opted for a chicken katsu kids meal and ala carte shrimp tempura and salmon sashimi. Sashimi was $11 and seemed spendy for the three pieces. 

Most of the sushi here is pretty mediocre. Not bad, but it's not knock your socks off.  The "creative" rolls like The Sunset were unimaginative and just alright.  We got an order of spicy tuna nachos. Guess we should've known based on the menu (see picture), but it was literally a heaping mound of spicy tuna served with something like sriracha mayo and Tostitos Scoops (yes, straight from the bag of Scoops that you would eat with jarred salsa). The spicy in the tuna wasn't even mixed evenly as the bottom of the lump was spicier than the top.

The honey toast is a poor representation of this great Japanese dessert. It was not Japanese bakery bread but a piece of King's Hawaiian sweet roll. The ice cream wasn't vanilla like described. It was more like a yuzu sorbet, but I thought it was better than vanilla ice cream. The sorbet was the best thing we had that night.

One of the tips mentioned the bench seating for each table. Not ideal but it wasn't too bad.

Doubt we'll be back here despite the convenience. There are many other AYCE joints in town to choose from which you'll leave much more satisfied.
The sushi is good and the portions of fish on the nigiri are great. And I love the staff!! Very comfortable and friendly atmosphere for a meeting with friends or a casual date.

AYCE sushi.
Doesnt get any better than this. Large selection!!!!! Very large selection of items to choose from.
Decor:I think they remodel since the last time I was here. 
Staff:Friendly.Helpful
Food:Excellent
Will be returning again!!!!
Easily my favorite sushi on the west side. Been here several times now and quality is consistently good. The AYCE is a deal for sure. Be sure to sit at the bar. The chefs are all awesome.

This place has an awesome vibe and amazing food. I met the manager Chris who took the time and made sure everything ran smoothly. He was very personable and I felt right at home. I will defenitley go back, especially for the buy one get one free saki!
Sushi is standard, service is poor,and forgive me but what self respective sushi restaurant doesn't sell kirin ichiban beer? Answer...this place.

Had all you can eat today! What makes this place stand out from all of the other sushi places in the valley is the FRESHNESS of their dish and seafood, you can taste it! It's delicious! The other thing is they haw reinvented some of the menu items with unusual ingredients, like the shrimp tempura smothered in yummy buffalo sauce or the added unexpected ingredients in their special rolls, like cilantro, asparagus, tomato, etc. Refreshing experience! And 5 star service! Will definitly go again! And again! And again! :)
Finally a good all you can eat in the area! Good menu and fresh fish. Trust your server on their recommendations.  Thrilled we don't have to drive so far for good AYCE anymore.
This was the second time coming here but never sat down at the bar was so worth the second trip food was amazing. Everything was fresh and tasted great.

My new sushi spot for sure.  The AYCE is the best around.  Fresh and quality fish, unlike some other AYCE around.  Whether you prefer nigiri, rolls, appetizers or entrees, this place has it all.  Their selection of rolls beats the competition.   Andrew and head chef Chris are fun to chat with and are on point with remembering your personal favorites.  Based on what we were ordering, they randomly served us a couple rolls and salads they thought we'd like.  And we loved them.  

Don't judge Hanabi by the lack of success of the previous venues in that spot.  These guys are on point.  Well done.

This place is over rated for sure. The waitress drops 2 tap waters on the table (super chlorine), I say UMMM we dont want water ( Saving LAKE MEAD water ) She said OH! So its 815pm and the entire Korean staff is filling the soy sauce bottles. I'm like wow they don't close till 11 p.m. how about some customer service. AYCE is only 60 minutes! Haha... She finally comes over I say do you speak Japanese ? She says no!  I say do you speak Korean she says yes then I start speaking Korean and she is stunned! JKKUHL bomb dropper! lol  Funny stuff...   Great news our waitress left at 830pm Haha....  more coming as we are waiting for our cooked food seems it takes a lifetime to cook.  THE CRAZY THING IS NO ONE IS HERE!
Ok food typical AYCE sushi some of the servers not so polite sitting there watching you and almost pressuring you to finish your food and get out also got very sick after eating here will not be back

Food was absolutely delicious!!!! They had some of the best blue fin tuna I've ever had. The owner and all of the staff is super friendly and welcoming. Will definitely be coming back here. Loved it!!

Very friendly server! However, super expensive for what you get. $25 for ten pieces of Sashimi, and that is all you get- not even a miso soup or house salad for that price. My roll was plain and terrible house wine. No other wine by the glass, except house. :( I hate writing bad/okay reviews, however, I will not be back here.

I've got a new spot for AYCE and it's Hanabi. A bunch of roll options and fresh fish. It wasn't packed like some of the other places in town but I think it's just because they're relatively new and undiscovered. Andy, the owner, is very friendly along with his staff. Great environment, great food, great value.
So good! We have been searching for a sushi restaurant closer to home and this was a lucky find! Excellent staff and incredible rolls. We will be back!

Really bland food. The edamame was probably the best thing I had and that was just okay. The Cajun tuna roll had a bland, weird flavor. And I had a specialty roll that I wish I never ordered. Plus the service was very slow.
Just ate here and its fantastic!!  Service great and very attentive. Will definitely be returning

Always amazing! Every time my husband asks me where I want to eat, I say Hanabi sushi! Owner chef Kim always remembers me and the food is perfect! All you can eat is the way to go. I highly recommend it to everyone. Just need to open his next one in Dallas, where we are moving!

So happy to have a good ayce sushi near home!!! Good selection of fresh sushi, appetizers, noodles and more! Our kids enjoyed the chicken teriyaki kids meal which came with a drink, appetizer and soup or salad for $7 while me and hubby gorged on SUSHI!  Will definitely come back and bring our friends!

I went in again and this place did not change and that's a GREAT thing. Food was super delicious. Prices are great. The atmosphere is fun and the sushi chefs are great guys and keep the mood fun and light. If you are wanting sushi, check this place out. You will not be disappointed.

The AYCE $20 special is extended until the end of November. I definitely enjoyed the special but I feel like their selection of rolls is a little short compared to other sushi bars I've been to in the area. Overall, I'd go back and grab the Coco Salmon because it's definitely a different taste than what I'm used to for rolls.

I ate 2 days in a row on friday and saturday with my co workers. Everything was super fresh and atmosphere was great. Nice services and nice music. Even though the restaurant was full of guests, food was served very quickly. We will definitely come back. I don't understand why people give this joint low stars. Thank you for having us, Hanabi!!!

We came in tonight an hour before closing and their last call for all you can eat was 9 but they still let us stay & order until 9:30. Even tho we had to rush it was such a good experience. The food was delicious and everything tasted fresh. The waitresses were so sweet & polite as well. They were very nice and didn't make us feel rushed to eat. We will be returning (:

This place ladies and gents is a Korean sushi restaurant. Don't confuse this with a Japanese sushi restaurant. The fish quality was sub-par. The sweet shrimp was probably old because it was cooked. Usually par cooking is a technique to somewhat hide the fishiness of seafood as it gets old. The sea urchin was horrible. It looked dark and tasted off. Usually it will taste creamy with a lil briney flavor but this was of bad quality. Appetizers were good. They were hot and crispy when expected. The place was empty at 9pm. Not sure if that's just the lack of traffic in the area but it seemed more like the public knew about the quality.

Not sure why there are so many positive reviews!! We went for lunch and the place was completely empty- that should've been the tip off. Our server was a young, bubbly woman who despite trying to be pleasant and helpful, rushed us through our AYCE lunches. She kept taking plates away before we were finished and threatening the "leftover food gets charged" policy (we had zero leftovers and I was still working on a plate with a couple pieces of sushi that she tried to take away before I was done!!). If you want details or her name please DM me.

The food was mediocre at best. Definitely not sushi to write home about. The tempura squid was not fresh, really the only thing I liked was the tempura shrimp!! I ordered as much sushi as possible (I love raw fish), but it wasn't that fresh. The ikura/salmon roe was a bit slimy in texture and tasted like it had been marinated in some sake or wine to disguise a lack of freshness. For sushi aficionados, any really quality item was off limits according to the menu (uni, amaebi, bluefin tuna, toro, oysters, etc). Dessert was decent (Mochi ice cream and regular ice cream), but there's a one item per person limit. There are plenty of AYCE places in town so I'll keep looking. I wanted to like this place but felt rushed through the meal and had to worry about so many restrictions (one item per person, off limit items, dinner only, etc) and the leftover policy that it did not make the experience enjoyable. I want to dine somewhere where we and our business are welcome, and where I can sit down and have a leisurely meal and be happy:)

Friendly, super fast service and the food is wonderful.
Thank you Andy.  You are the best.

Great sushi - had the volcano roll - a must do , creamy succulent deliciousness in a roll. Salivating yet ???? You should !!! Expeditious and friendly service. My siblings had yaki udon and raved about it all the way back to NYC. If you are a sushi lover or live Japanese cuisine and are in town... Try it !!!!!

I have been to many AYCE in Las Vegas and found this jewel today.
19,95 lunch included everything on the menu including crab , yakitori was delicious, great sushi , nice bright interior, lovely service , I be back soon one of the best I have been.

Going to leave the most accurate review I can. 

Price: This place is pretty pricey which is expected with sushi, but I paid 16.50 for 6 pieces of sushi it that gives you an example. They do have an all you can eat for 25$

Quality of food: I've been to 16 countries and eaten sushi in about all of them, ifs there's something I know and love its sushi. The sushi here was really sub-par it the rice did not stick at all causing the sushi to fall apart as it's picked up, not allowing you to eat it all together and enjoy it. Both of my orders had this issue. The flavor was as usual but nothing I'd expect with the price. 

Service: The service here is actually really good, its not a big place but still the servers are very attentive and always check in. I believe one of the chefs made a round as well. 

Atmosphere: The atmosphere is is nice, not crowded and has nice design a few TVs up playing sports channels, and seems like a nice friendly place to take the family.

Overall: The place isn't bad it's in a good location and has good service. The price vs the quality is what brings me to 2 stars overall when you go somewhere to eat those are my biggest factors. I'd recommend trying some other sushi place, you're in Vegas and can find amazing sushi anywhere so keep looking and save a few bucks for some good quality sushi!

I went here the other day as a lone diner and was impressed by the food and even more impressed by the friendly, helpful and attentive service. 
There was lots of choice on the AYCE menu. It's well worth it in my opinion. You can always order half sizes on quite a few of the rolls.
The food comes out quickly and tastes fresh. I also genuinely felt as though I could order as much as I wanted (apart from the one order pp items, of course).
The farewell from the chefs is a nice touch. I look forward to my next visit!

I've been wanting to eat here for awhile and decided to go a few days ago, overall the experience was a little lack luster. The service was good, it is one of those restaurants with a team serving mentality. All of the servers would check on us and we could order from whomever walked by which was nice. The decor of the restaurant was cute as well.

I had to knock of stars based on the food. I am an avid sushi eater and the quality of the nigiri was mediocre. The salmon nigiri was especially small and thin. The rolls were okay but had limited fish and an abundance of cucumber in them, nothing too great. I do have to say that their unagi was delicious and crispy, but once again small. I ordered honey toast which was an exciting addition to the menu since I've never been to an AYCE that serves that. It was just okay also - it seemed like a hawaiian roll from the market that they drizzled with honey and plopped a vanilla ice cream scoop on.
I am in LOVE with the baked lasagna rolls they're so amazing!!!! 10/10 would recommend sending all my friends here!!

Food: My family did the AYCE at 2 in the afternoon, all the selections that we did were very good, this a great go to spot if we are craving for japanese. They also have wagyu selections which  did not Try. There are some variations that are new which is typical some combinations worked really well.

Ambiance: Great quiet place although if dining with a big party it would not be advisable the area is small so the noise might affect other diners. Definitely a great neighborhood Japanese restaurant. 

Service: Very attentive, and was very accommodating with my family.

Overall: Would definitely come back and try other dishes on their menu.

minimal decor & 

I particularly like their shrimp poppers & sushi bomb roll

service was quick since it was in the middle of the day during a Wednesday afternoon. I guess my only thing i wasn't too happy about was that there was quite a few items on the acye lunch menu that was restricted to only dinner & only one order person. The chef came by and checked on us during our lunch as well.

Will return in the future for dinner

Unbelievable stuff!  Andy and his staff are gonna get a reputation fast around here for having top-notch food AND service.  I had multiple rolls and capped it with the honey toast, everything was just delightful.  This place is a wonderful addition to our neighbourhood and we hope they stay for many years to come.  I am their newest regular.
Great food and great service. The owner was very nice and I wish him the best of luck with his new business.!!

Rude hostess. Arrived 5 minutes before opening and when 11:30 AM came around she avoided us went inside and didn't come out - it was evident that no one was around and she was stalling; this would have been OK if she was nice. Taking my part of 8 else where. What joke they still have their grand opening sign and I was here over 2 months ago. No stars for customer treatment.

Pretty modern and cool little sushi spot. My bf and I sat at the bar, which was very clean and the staff was very attentive. Surpsingly they were attentive all the way to the end, unlike most sushi places who ignore you after your third order. The blue fin tuna and scallop nigiri were my favorites. I also like how they offer other dishes on the ayce menu such as curry. Kinda disappointed in their oysters though:/ they did not taste fresh and there wasn't any sauce with it. Sushi selection was very generic as well. Honey box toast and green tea cheesecake were good.

****Service - Food- Atmosphere is always excellent!!!! Consistent every time and gets even better the next visit. The only sushi place my family and friends come to because everything is always great. Fish is always fresh and the oil they fry in is ALWAYS clean. Owner always takes time to talk to his customers and frequently checks on everything especially the people. Unlike other sushi spots that always seem annoyed when you order "All You Can Eat" , Hanabi always gives you a great big smile and always asks if you would like more. Definitely the #1 spot for Sushi in Las Vegas!!!!!!! *********

I live in Anthem Highlands and found this Gem hidden in Summerlin. Sushi was outstanding and fresh, infact I made the 40min+ drive back the next day with another group. But the most outstanding part of this group was our waitress, Chika. She was attentive and suggestive. She was very proffesional and took care of us really well. This will be my new weekly sushi spot!
I eat here weekly because it is so good. The chefs are really kind and will tell you about new things you may want to try plus you can't beat the price. Truly one of the best sushi spots around.

This place is quality. Came late on a weekday and it was empty inside. Seating right away with drinks dropped off almost immediately. Did AYCE which includes basically everything on the menu. Started with oysters and seaweed salad followed by sushi and rolls. Everything looked fresh and tasted great. AYCE!!!!!
Good food and excellent service!  Nigiri  and sushi rolls were fresh and well made. Will definitely come again

I'm sad about writing this but as always my reviews contain my honest opinions.

My previous review from nearly a year ago gave this place 5 stars and in my opinion it was well deserved over several visits. 

I noticed that since last month (October 2016) they began an all day promo for only $19.99 for ayce which is good for lunch and dinner. This promo was extended until Nov so I took a friend here and was hoping it was just as great as it used to be. Unfortunately it wasn't. 

The rice was hard & undercooked. The fish slices were all significantly thinner. The fun Japanese music no longer played and service wasn't as good as it had been before. My favorite item of all is no longer included for ayce (uni) there's now an extra fee of $1 per piece. 

It just isn't the place I remember. Maybe business isn't as good as they expected but with the changes implemented it can't get better for them. I hope they make some changes soon so more people aren't disappointed.
My favorite sushi place! Always fresh and delicious food, and fantastic service. My favorite roll is the tuna special, but everything on the menu is great!

This place was excellent. The all you can eat applies to the entire menu and not just the sushi and rolls which is super cool. It also includes dessert! We were very happy with the quality of food and presentation. Service was great and all of the staff was very attentive. The staff also seemed to be very cohesive with one another and enjoyed their jobs. That was a great experience in itself. We will definitely be back!

Great AYCE deal! Fish is fresh, dishes are fun, service at the bar was attentive. As other reviews state, the AYCE dinner price is $28, which is slightly higher than the local average. However, quality here is among the best AYCE I've had and the majority of lower-priced businesses in town have significantly lower quality to match.

APPETIZERS: This was our favorite section of the menu. The Jalapeno Popper dish that is commonly found around town was nicely presented here and actually had a good kick of spice for once! Salmon poke had a great spicy chili sauce, both were offset by the seaweed salad. We really enjoyed the grilled mackerel and the soft shell crab, but I did not care for the oysters. The real standout was the Rock N Roll appetizer, which is a riceless roll! 
NIGIRI: Nigiri selection was ample, and fish was typically pretty fresh. The super white tuna, scallop, golden eel, and squid were good options, but I felt the salmon and yellowtail weren't that great and lacked flavor. Rice was an average portion, fish was cut on the thin side.
ROLLS: We tried the Twilight roll and the White Dragon roll, both had several sauces and fishes, both were tempura-shrimp based. I generally try to be more adventurous with my roll picks but by this point I was too full to care. Rolls were solid and they had a lot of new specialty options, but I wish they had more riceless options.

The space was another sushi spot before Hanabi took over, but the modern, clean dÃ©cor and chalkboard specials menu are a bit different. Service at the bar was attentive and we were frequently checked on by both chefs and management, though our empty dishes stacked up- this didn't really bother me, as they were pretty busy.

For those who are outraged by the higher AYCE price here- if $3 is really a deal breaker for you to drop your rating over, you have no business coming here. Stick to the Dollar Menu. The quality of dishes, freshness of fishes, and variety on the menu are more than enough to warrant the difference in cost.

TIP: Follow them on social media for a 50% off coupon for November & December for a la carte orders (good lunch option).

If you are looking for the best all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas this is the place for you. Owner Andy Kim worked at Nobu and yellowtail which I love and it shows with the quality of the fish and sauces. Great selection of sake and great sake!!!
I'm a big foodie and love sushi this is excellent! The sashimi always tastes fresh and the rolls are creative and satisfying.

What a gem! From the moment I walked in I felt this was going to be a great experience. The staff greeted me and was super friendly. The sushi was fresh and great tasting. The Coco Roll was my favorite, but honestly every roll I had was great! I will definitely be coming back to this place and making it a regular spot!
Order delivery didn't order sushi order the shrimp   dinner and the teriyaki chicken it was the worst food I ever ate in my life

This brand new sushi spot opened up in south summerlin and I could not be more thrilled with the experience! The atmosphere and decor was welcoming and my father (who I was treating to lunch) was particularly fond of the K Pop music playing on the sound system. 
The AYCE (all you can eat) sushi menu was pretty impressive and reasonably priced. $19.99 per person for lunch. We ordered SO. MUCH. SUSHI. 
I usually like the nigiri instead of the rolls, and when I received my order, I was BLOWN AWAY by the quality. The garlic tuna salmon nigiri LITERALLY melts in your mouth. The ikura (raw squid) was tender and not chewy.  I could not help but order more of the garlic tuna. It was so good! We also ordered the Japanese lasagna to share and it was perfect. I mean, truly divine. I wish I could remember our server's name because she was so sweet. She was a petite Latina and  was running the whole restaurant flawlessly!

The food is pretty good and the waitresses were nice... they should probably hire an extra person though since the wait takes a while to order stuff. Not a big deal for us though. The manager walks around to check on the service so that's good. We had a pleasant experience. Will come again.

I want to start by saying how amazing Andy the Owner is! We followed him from his old sushi bar to here just because of his hospitality, the variety and different rolls that you cant really find elsewhere, and the premium quality of the fish. He always had something new to try and he gets very creative with his menu! Loved eating here! We will definitely be back.

I love this place and definitely will be back! We went on a friday night, and service was very good. No wait for a party of 4. We chose ayce and ordered away. They allowed us to order as much as we wanted on the first turn. Most places only allow 2 at a time. They have plenty of selections to choose from! The dessert selection was more on the small side, but the dinner selection compensated for it. We were celebrating a birthday and the chef came out with a special custom birthday plate of fresh cut oranges. He definitely went above and beyond. I will definitely be back!

This place has amazing food, good prices, relaxing ambiance, great customer service and is by far the best sushi place I've been to in Las Vegas. The staff is so nice and they cater to you your requests. My wife and I have found our new spot. I will let everyone I know about this place. I highly recommend it to all.

By far this is the best all you can eat sushi and sashimi Resturant I have ever dine into here in Las Vegas!!!! Very clean atmosphere, friendly and attentive employees, amazing sushi chiefs and fresh sashimi! 
I really enjoyed their green tea cheesecake! I highly recommend everyone to eat here! I will definitely be back! Thank you sushi chief Jun and Chris!!!

When I moved to this side of town, one of my mission is to find a great AYCE sushi place. When I first came here, they literally just opened. 

I met Andy who was super nice and very accommodating. And all the staff until now are really nice and the service is always great. I usually like to do the dinner AYCE because I can order Sea Urchin and Sweet Shrimp with fried head (yummylicious). 

I recommend Hanabi for their quality of AYCE, service and the atmosphere of the place.

Can't say I would come back. The rolls and nigiri were average along with the service. Drinks had to be asked for multiple times. Appitizer orders were hit or miss on if they were coming or not. And the one issue I had that makes me not want to come back was the raw oysters I ordered were luke warm. Pretty much made me gag. This is not good since it was one of the last things I ate. It left me feeling like I was going to throw up.

If you LOVE sushi, This is the place!!  If you LOVE sake, This is the place!! The staff have been very upbeat and on point when it comes to customer service.  When you open your chopsticks and place the wrapper on the side of the table it'll be gone before you even know it. Chris has the most excellent customer service! First time here at Hanabi, already fell in love

As far as all-you-can-eat sushi places go, this is one of the best I've seen. I go every time I'm in town, and prefer to sit at the bar. The guys at the bar are funny, hard working, and very skilled. I always have a good time there, even though I'm often by myself. The food is very good, especially the nigiri and sashimi, which usually suffer at ayce places. 
To be honest, j haven't eaten a-la-Carte here, so cant speak to that. But the ayce option is great. Mix in a tall Sapporo and you e got yourself a great meal!
So delicious. The service is super fast and attentive. The menue has tons of sushi selection and the All You Can eat is a great value. The Mona Lisa roll was my favorite!

Very nice establishment for sushi. What brought me in was the fact they have Cajun albacore sushi! I swear, I could order 40 orders of those and I wound up ordering 30 or so? I went during lunch for AYCE and on a Wednesday afternoon it was empty so our service was fast. Their rolls are slightly larger than I'd like but we did our damage. As with any sushi establishment, I would not recommend the panko roll. I can't do fried rolls, but my friends who ordered it could barely finish it- it was too large! 

I really liked that they had honey toast for dessert, but their honey toast wasn't so much toast but a honey roll- I wouldn't order it next time.

Tldr; Clean establishment, friendly service, keep the Cajun Albacore sushi coming!
This is an awesome new sushi spot. The fish is fresh and the staff is very welcoming. The interior has a modern feel to it. I defiantly recommend this place.
Great place for sushi, fresh and is hard to believe that we are on the middle of Desert :) very friendly staff and good food selection

WOW, better than expected, Hanabi took the place of the 808 that was here, and I liked, but I was so surprised, and actually like Hanabi better. Better prices, more selection, excelent customer service. New, clean restrooms. Everyone is so polite, so nice. We will be back, most definitely!!!!

Items that lacked flavor: agedashi tofu & salmon cheese stick.  Items that exceeded expectations: salmon poke, salmon roe nigiri, white house, crunchy rainbow, tuna & bluefin tuna. I'm not a fan of Cajun albacore, but their's was great. The fish is perfectly fresh. The service was perfect. Chef Andy has a great pedigree & took the time to chat at length about the food and his vision.

I just to drive so far to get sushi. This pace has a great location on a very nice plaza. AYCE sushi of a great quality, nice staff and a clean modern design. Is now our favorite spot for sushi in town.

We have been here 3 times.  The 1st experience was great!  We sat at a table instead of the sushi bar and had AYCE.  The waitresses weren't as attentive as I would typically like, but we did get all the dishes we asked for and the variety of side dishes available with the AYCE is great!  We even recommended this restaurant to some friends that love it.  

The 2nd time we brought the kids along and they enjoyed it.  The 3rd time was date night and it didn't start off great.  We sat down and they brought us plates, 1 of which was really dirty.  We sent it back and a couple minutes later she returned with the dish.  Again, it was like pulling teeth to get them to come to the table to order more food.  It took about 20 minutes before she came back to get our 1st order and there were only 2 other tables there at the time.  I ordered a side dish of the vegetable udon and have had it before there, but this time there was something in it that was severely irritating my mouth.  Needless to say, with the poor service and inconsistency in the food, we won't be back.
Our go to AYCE spot by our place. Always fresh and friendly prompt service. Best miso!

One of the best run restaurants in Vegas, no bullshit. The first thing I noticed walking in was Andy, the executive chef, walking around to each table, making an effort to know each of his guests. The setting is very clean, and modern, yet nice to sit down and have a drink and some sushi whether you're by yourself or with friends. I tried a Japanese stout which I didn't even know existed until I came here. It was so nuts I had to try and was not disappointed. 

The sushi was great. My favorite was the salmon roll which consisted of cooked salmon. I normally prefer the raw condition, but the sauce and tempura coating really pulled it all together. I also enjoyed the panko roll, which was nice and crisp but full of sushi goodness.

All of the servers were on top of their game, friendly but not obnoxious. Definitely coming back here frequently.

First let me just say that I've been to my fair share of AYCE Sushi restaurants, and this one just did not make the cut, i actually made this Yelp account because i was so disappointed!

Overall presentation of the place is decent, looks clean etc.  

We ate here on a Saturday night around 7pm.  Place was a ghost town, so we were seated quickly.

Menu looked promising so we were anxious to try out some of their stuff!

Let me add real quick, that when i go out to eat, i take my 4 year old son with me as well, and EVERY other sushi place i have been to has AYCE options for children, whether its children's pricing or just half off the adult price. They have no such option here, and my son, who LOVES sushi and seafood, was extremely disappointed that he was not allowed any of the things that he enjoys !  It was pay full $30 (adult dinner price) for him, when he doesn't eat that much anyway or order one of the few meals they had designated only for children. He got stuck eating a very plain Kids Meal option. (California roll, miso soup, and 2 pieces of tempura for 8-$10) While i applaud that they have Kid's Meals at all, i wish they would've had an AYCE option for him as well. Some kids enjoy the flavors and variety.

We had some difficulty ordering from the staff/waiter who didn't seem like they spoke very much english, which happens in quite a few sushi restaurants around town, so we didn't think much of it. UNTIL After ordering appetizers and rolls to get us (ADULTS) started,
i tried to order Edamame for my son. i asked the waitress if i can get the Edamame A La Carte so my son could eat them.  i told her i would pay for it separately and everything ( Since he was not an AYCE ) and she said no, at which point i was confused and didn't understand why, so i tried asking again. To which she just kind of shook her head and winked at me and said "shhh" with her finger up to her mouth.  Either this place is just not KID friendly or the waitress REALLY does not speak English and had no idea what i was saying.  So at this point, before we even got any food i was already really disappointed with the way dinner was going. (we never got edamame for him)

Once food arrived, i can say that it was "fresh" in the sense that it was hot and seemed freshly cooked/made.  But the flavors on most of the rolls was quite bland and nothing amazing.  Even the appetizers were disappointing. Its not the worst sushi i've tasted, but it wasn't anything worth commending.  Also, we ordered my sons "Kid's Meal" first and his plain California roll came out AFTER almost all of our rolls did! Which just bothered me more... 

I think one of the biggest things that irritated us the most was at the end of the meal, we were left sitting there for about 15-20 minutes. They had cleared our table and still had not brought us our check which isn't necessarily bad, but once we did get the bills,  We noticed an added Gratuity. Which most sushi restaurants will add on for big parties. (We had a party of 5 plus the child who did not eat AYCE)  usually 12%-15%, NOPE! this place took an automatic 19%-20% Gratuity out of all our bills, totaling up to about $50-$60 in tips alone.  This irked us quite a bit, especially because we did not think the service or the food was up to par with such a generous TIP!   

I will not be dining here again.
it was not worth the drive or money.

Highly highly recommend !!!!!!!!
Tell Andi Robert sent you
This place is family owned and has a very extensive menu. There's no doubt in Summerlin area it's the best AYCE sushi restaurant. If you can't fill up and get your money's worth it will be your own issue.
This is the worse sushi I've ever had. Grocery store sushi is better than this place. The honey bread smelt rotten, I just threw it away.

Excellent quality, excellent service, outstanding sushi and great selection of premium Japanese beers that most sushi places don't offer.  No rush how long we stayed  and the price is right. Great place for the family and friends.

This little sushi spot located in Village Square used to be 808 Tapas...from the get go, the place is small but familiarly cozy. Nothing too special or out of the ordinary in decor, but a little on the modern side without getting too contemporary. Upon entering...greetings by staff welcome you like most Japanese places. All seem to be nice and helpful. Food wise, the sushi portion to rice ratio is a little off, sometimes more rice than other sushi restaurants. Food taste is pretty good to mediyoker depending on what you order.

This place doesn't seem to get overly packed, but it's a decent enough place to go to if you are craving sushi and in the area. Look for Yelp check in to unlock offers like sake. They also have specials going on on social media so be sure to check it out or ask to save on price.

Would I come back? Probably, but as a back up. Nice place to try though...you may have a different experience.

Hanabi is great for its price. Really good pointer is that they actually have a salmon or tuna poke or octopus for AYCE even during lunch, which is a plus because not all AYCE places serves that. 

Their shrimp tempura to die for. Hot and crunchy. Lunch is only 19.99!! They even have skewers which are my fave. I got the scallop and bacon which was SO scrumptious. Also ordered the salmon and white tuna nigiri. The salmon was okay. But the white tuna was super good and melts in your mouth. Decent sushi to rice ratio. Also ordered miso soup which was yummy and flavorful. And a spicy tuna hand roll which was also good. But if u want like avo or cucumber with it, u gotta ask for it. 
Then for dessert, I ordered of course the green tea ice cream which wasn't too frozen. It was good and tasted authentic. 

Service was nice. They never rushed us or bothered us while me and my girl were chatting away. They always came at the right time to ask if we wanted anything else to order. Also I think the manager would ask us randomly if we were doing okay during our time there which was nice. 

The environment is simple with tables and a sushi bar. But I do like the type of tables they had. It was wooden benches and wooden tables which felt kind of Japanese traditional. 

If you're in the area, I would def recommend this place. Food is great. Service is great. Price is even better!

Omg. The food here is amazing. I had all you can eat and each of the sushi pieces were thick. Service is great, overall this is like a hidden gem. Secret: try their Udon soup. BEST udon I experienced in Las Vegas.
Highly recommend! I was very happy with the quality of the fish and the presentation.  They serve large portions and the quality is excellent.  This is my new go to spot when I visit Vegas.

Came by after work for dinner, and fell in love with this place at first sight. Now I became a regular for their superior selection of sushi and their grills are a good pair with all the creative rolls they have. I tried the grade 5 kobe beef and the marbling itself says it all. Every bite melted in your mouth. 
Hanabi also offers great selection of premium cold sakes to premium japanese beers that not alot of other japanese restaurants have in stock of. One of my favorite sake :dassai which is more of a citrus and cleaner finish sake wine pairs well with chef's premium selection of sashimi!!  Get to know the sushi chefs! They'll definitely accommodate you from beginner sushi eaters to sophisticated eaters. Will be back again!

It's very open clean environment. The service was great, they cleaned off empty plates and refilled drinks regularly even though it was pretty busy. I quite enjoyed the iced green tea.

As for the food, the sushi quality is average at best. The enoki mushroom was drenched in butter (which you would think would be amazing!) and a bit salty, so... meh.

I liked the oysters, they were decently fresh. The spicy garlic edamame is good. The agedashi tofu was good.

The rolls were nothing special. The soup was overly salty.

Overall, service is better than the food.

This has been one me of my favorite places to eat sushi for a long time now.. the owner Andy is amazing and very friendly! However today I experienced something no one should have to ever go through. One of the server's ( small lady with glasses) was really rude and embarrassed me in front of my friends that I haven't seen in a real long time today. The situation started because I was taking the rice off of the sushi because Lord knows it was just to much rice on the sushi role.. lol Sorry( I had no idea ..I had to eat all the rice on an all you can eat menu lol! ) She came over to our table super aggressively and told us she was getting us our check with her hands in the air looking exacerbated..I became defensive and replied we are not finished eating and can you please prepare another sushi role. She replied back saying no.. and if I do I will grab you a half a role. I said why?.. she went back in the kitchen where our plates were.. brought it to the front of our table around my friends and other customers!   Saying(you didn't eat all of the rice on your plate!!!!) at this point I was just mortified!!!
I replied by saying  if i violated your policy.. pull me aside or you explain that I will be charged more and I would have totally understood! I immediately went over to the chef and asked is this how you treat your customers. He quickly apologizes for her action! He came over to the table to defuse the situation and the bad experience from his employee.
Please understand my rant.. This is one of my favorite places in the city to eat!! I tell all of my co-workers, friends, and family to go there. So to get treated like this was horrible! As we signed our checks I guess he sent her to tell us sorry.. but I refused to accept the apology because I knew it wasn't coming from a genuine place ( the boss told her to do it) 
Andy no one should ever be treated like this in any of your restaurants... And if these are the people you are hiring, then it says alot about you! 
You are the company you keep.

What a great sushi restaurant! Fresh delicious fish, great service with a smile! The grilled flat fish as well as the butter grilled enoki mushroom was to die for. Go for all you can eat sushi..... Well worth it!!

Eh.

I would equate this place to the Chinese buffet of sushi restaurants. The only reason I'm even okay with it is because it was only $20. If I had paid their "standard" $28 a person, I might have been pretty upset. The food just was not good; it wasn't well made, and the quality was subpar.

The service was fine and our drinks were refilled in standard time intervals. The atmosphere is slightly hipster with wood benches and thin cushions. Honestly, I liked everything but the food here. If I had to describe the flavors, it would be as if you handed me a recipe for sushi and I went to the local Food4Less to get my fish and tried to make the dish I home. Please keep in account that my cooking skills are almost non-existent. 

It may as well have been sushi you buy at Smith's. Not even in my top 20 sushi spots in Vegas.
Amazing food and all you can eat for $19.99 during the month of October. Great sake too! Must eat at!

Really good. The amount of rice is very small on sushi, which I really like. All the sushi and portions for all you can eat is very small and cute. I think it's better in that way so I don't over eat and I don't waste rice and sushi. Dessert is good as well, I love their mini honey toast and green tea cheesecake. Their soft shell crab is really good (one per person), blue fin tuna is also good, and I love their oysters as well. Overall the sushis are very fresh and small! a lot of choices in appetizer and grilled section :)

On the west side, this is a good, affordable spot for AYCE sushi. Service was excellent and fast. They have a big selection of crazy rolls, as well as more traditional sashimi. The tuna was super fresh, the white fish was okay (not as fresh as the tuna), and they have a bomb fried spicy tuna roll -super filling though! AYCE is $19.99 for lunch which is a great deal for the area.
Awesome! Great atmosphere. If you like spicy, definitely get the yellowtail special. Sushi bomb is also scrumptious.

I ordered through Eat 24 Hours. The food was tasty but it is a small amount for the $44.00 I paid (Rainbow Roll $12, Red Tiger Roll $13, Kake Udon $7, delivery charge, tax, and tip).

8-25-17

Thanks but I reviewed my old bill.

Food order $32.00
Delivery charge $4.99
Tax $2.61
Tip $4.40

Grand Total $44.00

Sorry and thanks. I will be sure to add this to the Eat 24 Hours page.

By the way, I can't wait to dine in one of these days.
Wait times for each tool aren't too bad. 3-8mins per and the all you can eat lunch special for $20 is a steal. I recommend the Double Crispy Salmon Roll!!!

I can't comment on the food so I won't give too low of a rating. But this place wasn't comfortable upon walking in. We walked all the way from the front to the sushi bar and no one really looked at us until we walked out. 

The restaurant is clean but that's not a surprise for a brand new spot. The most prominent thing in the restaurant is a chalk board that runs along the entire right wall and is covered with All You Can Eat rules (or All You Cannot Eat rules):

-No sharing
-No sashimi
-No customized rolls
-No a la carte then switching to AYCE

I don't eat shellfish and my wife can't eat avocado. This sounds like a very limiting situation for us. We eat tons of sushi, so it's not normally an issue. I won't list other sushi places on this review, as that's pretty mean. But it doesn't cost much for a restaurant  to accommodate a guest, especially if it's not busy. 

Note to owner:  I understand that you're running a business, but it's a hospitality business. Before you worry about your money, I recommend making your guests feel welcomed. I strongly urge you to erase the chalk board on the wall and put up a pretty picture of something that makes your guests feel happy. Put the rules on the menu and people will understand.

This is a well tasting restaurant, atmosphere is not so great had a deli like feel to it and the workers are not necessarily sufficient in English which I found frustrating, at one point the waitress gave our order to the chef he had an attitude as if he did not want to make it and shook his head. I could understand if it was busy but we were the only couple in the restaurant. Thus deserving three starts.

Okay.... so this place I have been eyeballing for quite some time and finally went in! To start, the restaurant is beautiful and the service was awesome. However, the quality of the tuna nigiri was subpar. The tuna was mushy and the flavor was off. Additionally, I opted to try their signature roll, the Hannabi and it was just okay. The asparagus on the inside was hard, and the roll completely fell apart. Also, they charge $8 for a draft Stella, which is a bit much! 

I wanted to love this place and came in because of the good reviews but after trying it I would have to say it did not meet my expectations.

Me and my wife are an avid fans of japanese food. She had lived in Japan for over 25 years so she has been spoiled with amazing sushi. When she arrived in the U.S., she wanted to try some sushi here. We had found a couple of good but just above average Japanese food since coming here. We decided to try out Hanabi since it was close to the movie theater and we were in a hurry to catch a movie. We tried a couple of rolls and got out since the movie was about to start. Needless to say, we went back to Hanabi and tried the all you can eat. We brought my brother and sister-in-law along with us from L.A. My wife was so delightfully amazed by their sushi. I myself was shock on how high the quality of fish they use. They are so fresh!!!  All we can say is amazing and delicious at the same time. I really can't recommend anything since all of the sushis and rolls were great. But if I have to choose a couple of items, I would go for the giant scallops and bluefin tuna. They are that good!  Andy, who is the owner, is so friendly and attentive. I can't say anything negative about his restaurant nor his staff. Jay, Jun, Jason and all the others were awesome. Thank you guys for having us. It was a wonderful experience to eat at your restaurant. This will be our only Japanese restaurant to go to. If they are close, we dare not to go elsewhere.  Lastly, this restaurant is simply just short of being in Japan. IT'S THAT GOOD!!!!

Tried this place out on a whim today for lunch, and was super pleasantly amazed. Great ambiance, perfect service and delicious food. Seriously no complaints whatsoever.

Will definitely be back sometime soon.

The Shrimp Popper appetizer, Mona Lisa roll and Terry special roll are all must haves. 

Highly suggest!!

This place took the spot of 808 sushi & tapas, so I figured they had to be really good. We decided to do AYCE. The food was good, but what killed it was the service. While the owner was kind, our server was probably not having a good day. It made our experience unpleasant. We had to ask for water multiple times. I don't know... Maybe the just need more help?

Four stars are for the food and decor. Service was good with two waitstaff.
I don't think I will be going back due to loud Japanese rap music blaring from speakers throughout restaurant.
Place is exceptionally clean with a simple, nice feel. Tables and benches are hardwood which is a little tough on your rear end.

I love the service and attention. Sushi quality is good not great. We've been a couple of times, here are my suggestions they need in order to gain a loyal following.

1. The all you can eat option has far too many restrictions, just raise the price and limit the restrictions to a few things. Or put those on a separate page of the menu.

2. Stop threatening to charge for uneaten portions under the all you can eat. Portions are so small I doubt it's a cost issue.

3. Delivery of food items gets very slow after the initial order, if that's intentional then stop it. It's very noticeable. 

4. Portion sizes of just about everything are the smallest I've seen in any sushi restaurant in Las Vegas.

Tucked into a shopping center is this fun little sushi bar.   Stopped here for some dinner while traveling with work.  The staff was very quick to greet me and had answers to every question. For a smaller restaurant they have really maximized setting without making guests feel cramped. They have tables for 2, 4, or 10 and if your looking to sit at the counter-- they have that too. 

My sushi was so fresh and tasty. They have so many different rolls to choose from and also a whole list of other dishes if your not feeling sushi.  I thought the prices were extremely reasonable considering the quality! 

Tip: They offer an all you can eat option, so bring your appetite
Delicious! Nigiri was absolutely fantastic. Would totally recommend. Great price for what you get! Honey toast is delicious, a must try.

I was so excited to finally eat here. Since being bookmarked and and teased by the good reviews and amazing food pics, we made it here!! 

Let me just get the food review out of the way. We ordered two kids meals for the kids while the hubs and I had AYCE dinner. The rolls we ordered were good!! Honestly forgot the names, so I am sorry for not being helpful with that part. Between us two, we also ordered the shrimp poppers (bomb), oysters (fresh), sweet shrimp, calamari, shrimp and soft shell crab tempuras (all yummy), baked mussels (good), sautÃ©ed spicy chicken (okay), and enoki mushrooms (I never even got it haha).

Two stars docked because...... the service SUCKED!!! My husband's rice took the longest to get to our table, and everything else already took long to arrive. Mind you, not even many customers were there. I can't imagine if the place was full. I understand, quality food takes a while, but this was ridic! Even after the owner came out and we complained to him, he said he was pushing our orders out asap..... uhm. Nope. Same shit! Took forever and they'd keep forgetting our orders. I never even got my darn Enoki.
This restaurant is the best Japanese fusion restaurant in town. Coco salmon is good....

We came in for lunch mid week. We didn't order any sushi, just a couple items off their a la carte menu. The Korean BBQ beef and a bento box with chicken teriyaki. The chicken is all dark meat which I personally think they should let us know. 95% of Japanese restaurants use white meat for their chicken teriyaki. The Korean BBQ beef was overly sweet and the beef texture was a little off. Like it was sitting in the marinade too long. The service was really slow because it was just one server for the entire place. We ended up paying 28 bucks for a cheaper cut of chicken and beef that sat in their marinade for a really long time.

I went with my family last night to try the restaurant for the first time and I must say I was really impressed! Wide variety of menu to choose from even for AYCE. Everything was very fresh, delicious and nicely presented. I loved the atmosphere - very clean, modern and welcoming. I really liked the contemporary decor with the bench seatings, nice and fun huge blackboard on the wall they can utilize for house specials and all-you-can-eat rules (which btw the rules are the same as any other all-you-can-eat sushi places. I didn't find it unwelcoming). The staff, especially the owner Andy, was all so enthusiastic and pleasant. Andy went above and beyond to make sure our dinner experience was to our satisfaction. Another nice thing about Hanabi was that they have cartoon channel up on 2 of their 4 TVs which my 7 year old son enjoyed watching while we took time enjoying the all-you-can-eat to the fullest! Normally he gets bored and ask to go home. He didn't this time and even said, food is good here let's come back! This will definitely be my family's designated AYCE sushi restaurant whenever we crave sushi. So glad we found this place!!

I haven't done the all you can eat yet, but for $28 I will definitely be back to try it. I had salmon, eel and tuna sushi and was impressed by all of it. Very high quality fish. The eel was especially good. It was my favorite of all three. It's not the cheapest sushi, but you get what you pay for here. It's better quality than any of the cheaper options. The service was very attentive, but not over bearing. Great atmosphere and very comfortable.
Wonderful staff, and best sushi in town. First pick for when we want sushi. Great AYCE pricing. $19.99 for lunch and $24.99 for dinner!

I ate at Hanabi with a friend for the first time last night.  The sushi was fresh and very tasty.  The staff was very friendly and efficient.  The restaurant was very clean and we'll lit.  All you can eat for $20 for the month of November. I plan to return to Hanabi real soon.
Great sushi! Andy, the owner, was very helpful and attentive and made some creative suggestions that made the roll I ordered perfect for me. Will definitely be back. Highly recommend.

Delicious fresh fish.  Good udon.. The rolls were absolutely fresh. This is a well priced ayca place that has exceptional service. Waitress spoke English and was very prompt with her service and any of our requests. My wife and I really enjoyed it!

Awesome sushi!! Great prices and ALL YOU CAN EAT!! 

Exceptional service in a neat traditional Japanese setting.  Even met the owner (Andy ...I think) :). 

I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND.  We tried everything from the miso soup to the awesome spicy tuna on crispy rice! 

The chef prides himself on having super high quality tuna and beef options as well!

My new go to spot. When you in Vegas come here !
I love theAndy roll and the dynamite roll. Yumm

Excellent menu and exceptional service. The owner Andy really cares about his customers. The chefs are friendly and offer thoughtful recommendations. Their Dynamite is dy-no-mite and I'm a huge fan of the soft shell crab appetizer. The fish is fresh with great portions.

Happened to stop by last Wednesday prior to hitting up a movie and our party of three was pleasantly surprised with the choices we made. We started the meal off right with finding a nice steal on the drink menu (Nigori bottle for $15). I enjoy the unfiltered sakes over filtered as I find the sweetness compliments most of the roll ingredients (i.e. Yuzu, cilantro, jalepeno, ginger etc). We ordered four different specialty rolls of which I recall the Mad Caterpillar (eel/tuna) was the best one. The service was on point and the cherry on the top was that the bill was 50% off (assuming to bring in more traffic on Wednesdays).  Regardless of discount, we would come back.
