Always good. This month even more because its 20.00 for all you can eat. The staff is freindly and efficient. The sushi is delicious and fresh. 
My favorites are Monkey Brain
                              Salmon cheese sticks
                              Twilight
                               Fire Volcano
                               Saba
   .                           Tempura Veg
The food was absolutely amazing. Fresh tasting. We will be back. Thank you Jay our waiter excellent service. And most importantly to Andy the owner that made sure we were satisfied......

Awesome! Try Korean bbq roll, if you love beef it's a real twist. Delicious and they have all you can eat. Yes really! Clear menu options and cool drinks with jelly. Wild, clean, friendly...My new preferred place over S---- Fever.

Twenty five dollars for all you can eat sushi.  Amazing tuna and salmon quality!  The price includes hot rolls, tempura rolls, poke bowls, and unlimited appetizers. Cannot beat the price nor quality!  I keep going back

FINALLY! A great sushi restaurant in Summerlin!!  Nice bright setup, fantastic prompt service, fresh tasty sushi. 

Sushi chefs Andy (owner) and Chris were delightful and engaged during our visit making sure everything served was exactly as ordered and to our satisfaction. 

As sushi fanatics, our group was overwhelmingly impressed with the quality/taste/and selection. HUGE MENU! From the tuna poke to the kobe beef our taste buds were in constant excitement as every dish served never failed to impress.

Noteable must-haves: Alaskan King Crab, Toro, Citrus Yellow Tail (all of the tuna is excellent), Oyster, Jumbo Scallop (Phenomenal!), Fried Garlic Chicken, A5 Kobe Beef (not an easy find in Vegas).

Great experience. This is my new go-to sushi spot. 

**As an added bonus** the selection for your non-sushi eating friends was SUPERB. Let Andy or any of the chefs know and they will cater to any request. Our non-sushi eating friends (what!?) were pleasantly surprised by the selection and tastes they were able to enjoy.

I happened to have a really good experience here. I usually don't care about the level of service I'm receiving as long as the food is good, but in all seriousness, the waiters and waitresses were extremely attentive on my visit, which I was really appreciative about. I especially appreciated how the owner was really friendly!

But on to the more important topic, food:

The appetizers here were sooooo good. I forgot the names of them, but one of them had like a spicy salmon that you mix with seaweed. You mix it up and then eat together. The flavor was so good! I believe it was called Salmon Poke. Who knew mixing the two would taste so good together?

I went with a group of sushi eaters, so I can't comment much about the rolls since our meal mostly consisted of sushi. I really enjoyed the tuna, which after having visited Japan, I get really weird about eating tuna here in the States because nothing tastes as the real deal. But the tuna here was surprisingly good! My favorite was the mackerel though I believe it was. It tasted extremely fresh and had the nice flavor you expect out of piece of sushi.

My group also ordered a yellowtail collar that was SO GOOD. The meat was soft. It had really good flavor, and I seriously wished I ordered more of it.

We also had kobe beef here, and it was sooo good. It shocked me to see that they had real kobe beef, but they even had an official certification for how legit the beef was.

New place, we apparently went to the grand opening and overall the sushi was pretty yummy. Prices are pretty typical for AYCE, and they were able to do half rolls so that was good. They had a grand opening promo where if you checked in on fb or twitter you got to draw out a paper that gave you a free drink or even a bottle of wine, so that was nice (though I'm not a big wine drinker). Service was very attentive and the staff was friendly. I think we'll return and try more things.

My boyfriend and I went around 3:30 on Monday and sat at the bar, we both got AYCE which was dinner pricing at $28.  We both commented on how much we liked the tables and that the overall appearance of the place was nice.  Our food took a while to come out, we also ordered a King Crab Miso from our waiter which was a la carte, we later had to request it again because it never came, we were both really excited about the King Crab Miso and both woefully disappointed by it, it had so many mushrooms in it that initially we thought that was the crab, the crab we did find in the soup was grainy and just had an unpleasant texture.  The sushi overall was good, we both enjoyed our food, my boyfriend wished the rolls had been bigger but I didn't mind the size of them, more room for more food in my opinion.  Overall we would come back, probably during lunch time though, it was a little expensive during dinner pricing.

Upon scrolling on the Yelp feed I came across this sushi restaurant so me and the beau decided to check it out. This place actually took over where 808 tapas used to be. I didn't know they closed down! Everything looked the same when we walked in though. Maybe different stuff on the walls.

It wasn't too busy so we sat down right away, AYCE dinner was 28$. A little more pricer than the usual. Once you check in you can get BOGO free house sake so I took advantage of that. But I decided plain sake isn't for me. 

The fish was pretty fresh. The rice/fish ratio was pretty even. That's always a pet peeve of mine at sushi restaurants. The menu had some amazing new items that you don't usually see BUT they weren't part of the AYCE which was a bummer. They did have oysters on the menu 1 order per person but they didn't have tabasco or the cocktail sauce you usually put on oysters. 

The jalapeÃ±o poppers were amazing and also the rock n roll was bomb. It's a rice less roll which I love love those! Looking over the menu again I forgot to try the Monkey brains. Dang it. 

I ordered seaweed salad, it had a really distinct Taste to it that I didn't really like. I got the green tea cheese cake and it was so small! I had to laugh because I saw pictures of it but didn't think it really was as small as it looked in pictures until it was in front of me. 

The service was quick and efficient so no complaints there. 3 stars because it really wasn't mind blowing but overall we had a nice dinner there.

Super fast chefs! Ordered 8 different sushi rolls and a bowl of miso soup, took them 10 min to make and place in individual containers. Courteous chefs and a very very very polite hostess made the visit pleasant. Especially after a long day at work. Great spot to come for late night sushi craving if you are in the area. Plus, unlike most kitchens in the area that close 30-45min before they close at 11pm, theirs takes orders until they close it seems! That right there is perfect for us folks getting out of work after 10pm.

We had been to this restaurant several times when it wasn't busy things were fine. Went again with friends on a busy night, man was the service awful ! 
We ordered several dishes and they all came out at the same time, we were hoping they would stagger them. And then the servers were never seen again. My friend ordered a refill of tea and they didn't come back 'till the check came. In the end the owner stopped by, my husband who knew I was dying of thirst asked him for a glass of water as I was parched and could not get a servers attention for over 20 minutes, he had a waiter bring me a to go cup. The problem is there was not one server per table so there was no investment or awareness of each table's progress or needs. Servers just dropped off orders and were never to be seen again. Would not go back...
The best shushi in Vegas! They were so wonderful to us too! What a great night. Pork belly might have been the best thing I ever ate. Korean oysters were amazing

OK so I love this place. The staff are talented, kind and humble... That's a great combination in my book. I have been twice since they opened. On both occasions the quality of the fish was excellent, extremely fresh. I know in Japan it's customary to judge a sushi restaurant on the Tomago, my litmus test is typically the yellow tail and it was as good as I have eaten anywhere.   It's not just the fish though, they have a great menu which brings together many different styles of cuisine from Japan.

I have been to quite a few all you can eat sushi places in Las Vegas, they usually bloat you up with a bunch of rice and overdone rolls. Not here, the all you can eat option includes regular sushi as well as rolls (including almost all of the special rolls) and other options like Japanese curry and Korean BBQ beef (which we didn't get to eat because our 1 year old devoured it, the guys were cool about that which was another plus in my book).

I go by my gut when it comes to most decisions in life. My gut told me these are guys who have integrity and they care about what they do. We will be back here at least once each week.

Thanks guys for an awesome experience!

The AYCE menu has a wide variety of food to choose from and even the dessert was included in the AYCE, unlike other places we've been to. Everything was very delish! The only thing was their hard (but cute) benches. Tables were a bit small with all the little dishes on the table (party of 4) but most of all, my butt started hurting after a while due to the hardness of the bench. Also it being a bench, there's nothing to lean back on so for people who like to lean back, they're out of luck.

Everyone in my party had the AYCE and I had the Sushi Bento because I just can't eat enough to make the AYCE price worth it for me. My bento was good good good!

They had nice music on but they could have toned down the volume. It was too loud for our conversations.

This place has the freshest sushi in Vegas ! Always a good time when we come here . Staff is nice .. Quiet environment and great location! Try the fried jalapeÃ±os and the crab mania they are amazing ! I love this place and will come back many many times !!!

Came here after a long day of climbing in Red Rocks. I don't expect the best food in the world from an all you can eat sushi place. I would have given it three stars but the oysters that were included in the meal came warm, almost at room temperature, and tasted awful. They took them back and overall everything else was fine but more on the scale of super market sushi than restaurant quality. If you want to get full its not so bad but stay away from the oysters!

Ok the food was good.  But thats about all i can say, which I suppose is important considering it IS a restaurant.   
BUT.....  I expect a lot more from a restaurant -- especially a new one listed as "hot and new" (at the time).   Yep, I will go on about this, anyone who reads my reviews will hopefully get it.

1. MUSIC.  Im not just saying I didn't like the music.  there was something  REALLY wrong with the sound system like someone disconnected a wire and only half of the frequencies were coming out of some fried wire behind the furnace(??).  I swear it wasn't just me.  My friend who was with me works in music and even offered to go fix the system for them.  It was SO bad i felt kind of queasy or bad trip or something. Completely distracting, especially combined with........
2) YELLING! Every time anyone would walk in the door there was some sort of yelling they did.
I understand if it was one of those places that had games or an mc or whatever (they have this crap in north hollywood but this is like the outskirts of las vegas)  and also florescent lighting,  Totally please NO.   
3) the "all you can eat" rules and regulations.  Im not an "all you can eat" person.  First of all, i can't eat very much and second because i don't like rules!   These rules were so confusing and restrictive.  They could not totally explain them (maybe because its a new place?) yet, anything we asked for seemed to be impossible. Also, there were all these stipulations written in chalk on some blackboards near the ceiling.  I just wanted a tuna roll with avocado, but that turned into a humongous discussion i finally gave up and got shrimp hibachi.  Then I spent a long time looking for a shrimp within a sea of diced zucchini.  
On the more positive side, its 2 for 1 saki and  there was some sort of shrimp ROLL that everyone in the entire place was going crazy for.  I just don't order shrimp rolls.  So maybe IM the problem!!!?

I feel a little bad saying all this, hence the 3 stars rather than 2, mainly because the staff was super nice and obviously trying very hard to please everyone.  I hope they can work out the sound system thing.  Also, its right next to a big movie theater so its technically a good dinner and a movie place!   

follow chalk instructions, wear earplugs, the theater is 2nd run movies so tix are cheap.  
I would go again, but not on purpose...... or get take out.  truth be told, we were aiming to go to the thai place next door which is for some reason closed on tuesdays.  wow.

All you can eat is so good & worth it! For less than $30 a person you can get completely full & enjoy countless dishes! I've had the all you can eat here about 8 times & keep coming back for more. Can't wait to go back again soon!

Great choices and food! My favorite go to is the Mona Lisa. You can also call and order to go if you're in a rush, they're very fast. 


All the staff (and the owner) are super nice!

Great AYCE sushi. I come here all the time. Quality sushi for the price you pay. The customer service is very good, also a plus. I had the spicy garlic edamame which definitely had lots of flavor with a kick. I ordered the veggie tempura, crunchy and delicious! Would definitely recommend the green mussels. Had the Chef's special sunrise roll which i loved. Also tried the animal which was good but I didn't like as much as i liked the sunrise. The oysters were very fresh and meaty. Enjoyed some nice sake and ended the meal with some green tea mochi, my favorite!

I must say this is one of my favorite all you can eat place in Vegas for Japanese food. Been here more then several times so that would explain a lot. It's only a 4 star and not a 5 due to the fact that I had to ask for refills other then that last order is 10:30pm

Wonderful! Wonderful! AYCE Sushi Dinner! Overall Excellent experience for myself and my daughter who is hard to please when it comes to sushi. Sarah, Jade, The two Sushi chefs and the appetizer guys in the back. Two thumbs up to all of you. This place might not be perfect but it won't disappoint!
The food was fantastic, everything was delicious and had a nice variety. The service was phenomenal, very friendly and  diggin the vibe. Our go-to spot when we want to cure our sushi cravings.

Hanabi is a hidden gem in Village Square. The chefs are very friendly, and the fish is some
Of the most fresh I have had in Las Vegas. The lunch special is awesome, only $20 for AYCE, and has very few restrictions. The Miso Soup, Pork Belly, and salmon are MUST HAVES. also, the super white tuna is served with a drizzle of sesame dressing that is fantastic!!

me and my friend went there for lunch for the first time, waitress had no idea what she was doing, the chef had to step up and answered simple questions over the menu

Me: hello chef what are your specialties here? 

Chef: oh im korean and i make great short ribs! 

Me: ............... I literally just paused 

Dont get me wrong, With all due respect I love korean short ribs but when I am at a sushi restaurant and I would like to eat some fresh sushi but he decided to offer me short ribs? 

I mean I could have gone to a Korean bbq place for that lol

Decided to try this place out for ayce and the price was pretty decent for lunch ($19.99) which ends at 3 pm. There was only one server going around checking up on all the customers, but she was very efficient and incredibly nice. 

We ordered 7 rolls: 
-Andy special
-Hanabi special
-Sunset
-Caterpillar
-Crab Mania
-Sushi Bomb
-Full Moon (Only deep fried roll)

The wait is longer here because if you order your rolls, they will make them all at once before serving it to you. Unfortunately, all the rolls were just mediocre :-( The rice was falling off some of the rolls and a bit difficult to pick up. 
I had the green tea cheesecake for dessert, fairly good but pretty small. Unlike other places, you are only allowed to choose one type of dessert. For example, you cannot have ice cream and a mochi. You have to specifically pick one or the other. 
Overall, it was disappointing.

This place is good. I like the decor and the wait staff were super nice. I ordered ayce and I can say they do not dissapoint. I got all of my usual nigiri favorites along with the fresh uni and softshell crab tempura and hamachi kama. Quality wise, hanabi can be comparable to a place like oishi sushi also on sahara or even naka sushi, on lake mead and rampart. Nothing spectacular, but a solid neighborhood sushi spot that has tasty good quality fish and friendly warm service. It is, when in proximity, the go-to place to raise your blood sugar to the gods, especially when stranded in a crazy random and ridiculous flash flood.

Sushi really small portions but the appetizers here were good.  Soft shell crab, salmon/tuna poke were decent as were the skewers. 

Had a sushi craving but it didn't satisfy.  It wasn't horrible but doubt I'll ever come back.  If you want more sushi then you'll be disappointed. All hot items were pretty good though

My boyfriend and I got delivery sushi, we put on the website that I wanted avocado so they called back., and said because it was the first time and and it wasn't an extra to was going to be for free the avocado, so we got the food a little late, and also the taste it didn't amazed me , it wasn't worth it, glad they didn't charge the avocado ...
This was amazing sushi and everything was soooo fresh. The Yellow Tail was the best I ever tasted.

Hanabi is the new Sushi sensation in north Las Vegas. With great service, beautiful smiles and amazingly fresh sushi, Hanabi have been catching everyone's appetite! All you can eat sushi is their speciality, so go on and make a reservation for dinner because they are busy!
Hands down the best sushi in Vegas. They also are very accommodating to gluten allergies and carry gluten free soy sauce.

I yelped a place that was close to my mother's nursing home, while visiting her today . This place was nearby and had good stars . I order expensive sashimi. However , the pieces were super tiny . I mean I'm buying hamachi yellow tail and Tuna even Ikura and sea urchin . Yet you can take my index finger and my thumb  and do a tiny pinch that's how big my sushi pieces were. Waste of money to me I've had sushi spots that had huge pieces of sushi I will ever come here again.

When ever I'm in the west side of Vegas, this is our favorite sushi place. Crazy clean place with amazing quality. The all you can eat is a winner. But, if your looking for a lighter meal, the selections and special rolls are on point. Service is superior to all the rest in the area and the attention to detail and presentation is spot on. Be sure to ask the chef for his special creations not on on the menu. You can't go wrong with his recommendations. Live on the edge. Oh, and he also has an awesome personality and will always make you smile. #KillerSushi #HanabiSushi

Sushi was very good and reasonably priced and the service was great. Everyone was very nice, including the owner who was more than willing to interact with us. He as well as the wait staff really wanted to make sure everything was to our satisfaction.

If there was zero stars, I would have given zero!  I have been to Hanabi several times.  Service is so bad!!!!!!!!!!   I've never had any restaurant that continuously yells at customers.  Maybe the owner should give the employees customer service training.  Although my server today didn't even speak English.  I asked her if the restaurant served alcohol she replied I don't know!  I would think that that is something you would train your employees on.  The sushi is usually mediocre.  The all you can eat is limited, and they constantly yell at you throughout the entire meal that you cannot share.  I haven't even picked up the fork yet, and I'm already getting yelled at!  Secondly, I was given a wrong roll and then yelled at me again, saying I ordered it when I did not.  I ordered something completely different.  A second waitress came up to the table and called me a liar basically... she continued yelling at me when there was a very easy resolution...  she could've just brought the correct item.  Also when it is all you can eat, why are you coming back at me and yelling at me?  This place sucks. Don't waist your money!

I've eaten it almost every sushi restaurant here in town I would rather eat Smith's Supermarket sushi they never try to eat here again service sucked they kept messing up people's orders we got other people's orders that we didn't order the fish was tough Bland nasty anything that look decent were interesting they were out of or didn't serve any more save your money crack open a can of tuna it'll be alot more worth it !

JUST ANOTHER AYCE SUSHI JOINT 
.
**2017 Yelp 100 Challenge LV #3**
.
This place LOOKED NICE so hubby & I thought we would make a quick stop & have a little bite... the interior was clean & small. The staff was nice. 

We did not get the AYCE because we had already ate & just wanted some UNI & SALMON for dessert.... we made the wrong decision... we went in and sat down at the bar since we would be quick.  We might as well have gotten AYCE instead of A LA CARTE since our bill ended up being $45 which $7 short of the AYCE total.... then we could have at least tried some of the hot food to give the place some justice.

UNI $7 - tasted like the scrap part of the uni... the parts of the UNI you can't even tell it is uni... I REALLY don't want to say this but I thought I was eating in a SEWER when I put it into my mouth.  So I had to force down the other piece with a WHOLE bunch of kizame wasabi & soy sauce.

SALMON BELLY - this was their special for the day... hubby said it was super fishy.... this I'd coming from a man that critiques every sushi JOINT solely based on their salmon.... the most common fish that sells the most....

I wish I could go back but if you ruin someone's palate w/ bad uni.... it's hard to go back... the quality was BEYOND hiding behind the excuse of AYCE

New fave ayce sushi place. Amazing selection, service was good and the sushi was fresh. The fish portions and appetizer portions are smaller but this allows you to try more items on the menu- of which I feel the need to try everything.

Had a large party for dinner at Hanabi on a Saturday night, my second time there:

+
Welcomed our group of 20+ folks.
Great selection for AYCE.
Met Chef Andy, who was a delight and also provided complimentary champagne for my birthday.

-
Took a while to take our orders, and for some reason took only the AYCE orders first (majority), and didn't come back to get the a la carte people until much later.
One of our party did not get even half of their AYCE order brought to his table, nor was any apology given or ammends made when he brought it to their attention.
We did not get all of the AYCE items the waitress wrote down that we ordered.
I didn't appreciate being asked who in my party left a poor Yelp review, and nothing done to encourage that person to return. A comp'd meal? A gift card/certificate? Dessert on the house?
A birthday card of mine was trashed, not saved by the staff.

Just had lunch at this new restaurant that took our other fave, 808 Tapas... Bummer they left, BUT this place exceeded my expectations. Delicious food, friendly staff, and VERY clean!  Now a new favorite place.

Alright, so overall, a great place for AYCE sushi. Awesome price.

Sushi- so they call the ngiri sushi, so I will too. The sushi is always great- two tiny pieces (NOT WORTH IT UNLESS YOURE DOING AYCE) I always get 1 bluefin, 2 tuna, 2 salmon, 2 superwhite, and a yellowtail. In my opinion, solid food. Decent quality- for 25.99 AYCE, worth it.

Rolls- be careful. If it says habeÃ±ero, it's not a good roll. The habanero rolls literally have no flavor. They don't put any good sauce, just dumb horrifyingly hot sauce on it. Rock and roll is good, as are the dragons. If it's spicy, be wary.

Other stuff- oysters not good, but what can you expect, pork belly AWESOME, chicken good, jalapeno poppers delicious, shrimp poppers good, ice cream good. 

Again, it's crazy that they can sell all that ^ for 25.99 for everything total. That's ridiculously good prices for good quality food. The service is nice and the food comes out SUPER FAST.

Update: when I went here with someone they ordered the shoyu ramen. I tried the broth and it had a really nice, clean flavor, so when I came back, I decided to try the tonkotsu ramen. It came hot, like it should be, and the broth was nice. Noodles were cooked well and tasted like they had just been cooked. I personally prefer thin noodles instead of these thick ones, but whatever. I do have a few criticisms: first, usually they have an egg with a liquid yolk, which is always nice to mix into the broth. Also, the ramen literally had broth, meat, and green onions. Nothing else that I could see. Lots of pork meat, however for some reason it wasn't seared? Normally it has a crispy skin and then soaks in the broth to a crispy outside super soft inside that melts into the broth. Instead, it was just soft.

Now onto the important part: the broth. At first taste I loved the broth. It wasn't a clean flavor like the shoyu- instead it was a thick, flavorful broth. Both broths seem good and different. The broth was pretty awesome. Once it cooled I got a clearer taste of the broth. It wasn't as porky, though... it tasted a lot more chickeny. Personal preference, a thick porky broth is Best, but a thick chickeny broth was good too (it is tonkotsu though... maybe I'm wrong and there was no chicken flavor)? It almost tasted like a super high quality top ramen in a way, very chickeny. Anyway, I enjoyed the broth, just needs a little more. Please sear the pork skin to make it a crispy outside!!! Add a little more into the broth, like some bamboo, to make it more interesting in my opinion.

Came here at lucnh by myself and sat on the bar. 3 sushi chefs are on duty so my orders came super fast. They only have one server but it feels like there's also 3 of them. She was friendly, efficient and took very good care of every customer. Sashimis came out fresh and hot appetizers taste excellent! Will come back again, with the family next time. They really do a great job here! Highly recommended!
Delicious, cheap, casual, and exactly what you want when you go to  binge on sushi with your girlfriends. So stoked to have found a sushi place in Vegas!
Love the lychee sake here! Food was fresh and good too and the waiter was very polite and helpful. Can't wait to go back!

Great AYCE sushi spot. Good variety and the best hamachi I've ever tasted.  The service was a bit slow, but nothing to keep me from going again. Also, there are certain menu items that are only included with the dinner AYCE, which was a bit disappointing. Overall, the quality sushi will bring me back!

Wow, never again!  This location states it is a Japanese sushi location however the owners and staff are Korean.  They do have an all you can eat menu however prepared to get a lecture on the rules of all you can eat and be watched like a hawk while you are eating.  Service was below  what was expected, as our table went over 15 mins with empty glasses.  Green Tea cheesecake was frozen in the middle and then dry on the edges, when I asked the staff about it they state they keep it in the cooler and then MICROWAVE it before for serving - I was not able to eat it however I was charged for it anyway after I requested for it to be removed from the table and my bill.

AMAZING! BRILLIANT!! CREATIVE!!!
ABC's if a Fantastic Dinning Experience!
Food, presentation, service all A++
To get this quality in Vegas....an absolute must!
Andy and his staff are top notch!
Creative, friendly, welcoming....just a fantastic experience!
Came here randomly on my lunch break and now it's my go to! The prices are always great and the service is always on point. They are very creative and have a bunch of options for the AYCE!
Amazing service and food! I highly recommend this fantastic restaurant to any sushi lover. Definitely a must stop for great sushi.
Just a FYI if when your ordering their sushi is not your normal size, more like mini sushi   I was so disappointed after ordering to go. However, the waitress/hostess was nice.

This place is really nice! Management even shook our hands and treated us like friends. My significant other loves the vegas roll. I love all the salmon! If you're near village square, it's definitely a nice date spot!
The sushi was very good along with the appetizers. I came back another time for their all you can eat sushi already.

I liked this place & enjoyed their sushi here. My friends and I had AYCE sushi and shared with each other all that we ordered. 

They even have all you can drink Sake! Lol! Personally, all you can eat/drink is a bad combination but whatever floats your boat!

The one thing I have to say about this place is that my brother and I both ordered the baked salmon roll and his came, but mine did not. I asked if mine was coming and the server said it was. 15 minutes later, the rest of our orders came and my baked salmon roll was still missing. So another server came and asked if we would like to order anything else, I then asked about my missing baked salmon roll, she said she would check on it & never returned for the rest of our dining. THEN, my friend ordered 4 rolls and only 2 returned. 

Once we all decided we were finished eating, we STILL had not received our orders. My baked salmon roll never came and neither did her 2 other orders. 

All in all, I enjoyed my dining experience here, but I wish that they servers here put in effort to correctly bring out food out.

Friendly and knowledgable staff, great food and good prices! What's not to love about Hanabi Sushi? We had the Fire Volcano, Red Dragon and Yellowtail Special. The Yellowtail was our favorite! Will be back to try more from this great sushi place!

I enjoyed the freshness of the fish.  Each dish is presented in an exquisite fashion.  This is one of those hidden jewels.  I hope patrons give them a chance.  I hope they stay there for a long, long time.

This is probably one of my favorite AYCE sushi spots! It has great quality fish, and amazing servers! They never make you feel like your ordering too much and they come back asking if you'd like more (with a smile) up until you pay! It's 24.99 for dinner and they let you order everything on the menu!

Great food. 
Friendly staff.
Good AYCE assortment. 
Good happy hour.

My boyfriend and I will be back!

Everything is incredible. Staff is very friendly. Most importantly: all the food is fresh and clean. Never any fishy strong odors. The chefs are also so fun to sit by. My go to Sushi Place in Summerlin. All you can eat is SO WORTH IT. All the rolls are amazing . Once I was sick and I ordered the beef udon soup and it was the best soup ever. Overall this place is THE BEST

Before I begin I would like to add a disclaimer to my personal review of this restaurant. By no means am I trying to pick on any particular individual with this review. This review is based on my first time experience to eating at this restaurant.

Cleanliness 1 star

Ambiance/decor 1 star

Food quality 1 star

Customer service 1 of 2 stars

Over all this is a good place for those who love AYCE sushi. The modern look and family style seating are very welcoming when you first walk in. At a glance of the whole restaurant the level of cleanliness was more than acceptable. Quality of fish used for the sushi was hit and miss. I was served on a couple of occasions some sushi that didn't look fresh and didn't taste fresh either. Food quality for the rolls was good. Now for the customer service I experienced wasn't the best. To give some background I worked in the restaurant industry for 3 years. I know when the major rush of customers come in to restaurants. To avoid the rush and enjoy the experience of eating sushi I chose to come in on a Saturday mid afternoon. I was literally the ONLY person there at the restaurant. I was greeted by a waitress almost immediately which was great. I enjoy sitting at the sushi bar to interact with the sushi chefs as they are the experts. Unfortunately this is where my experience went south. The sushi chef catering to me was not as friendly and very short with the conversations I would try having with him. I felt rushed with ordering sushi when I just started eating a roll in front of me. I kept getting rushed and kept getting asked what else I wanted when I wasn't even finished with what was in front of me. It became somewhat uncomfortable. I heard someone say hello and it seemed to be the manager or owner as their communication/people skills were very good. Unfortunately due to the poor service I felt I was receiving from the sushi chef I was too poor in a mood to really interact with this gentleman. The waitress definitely was kind and made sure everything was ok with me. Aside from that, my personal opinion on the sushi chef attire was very poor. Using baseball caps and inconsistent attire reflected in the attitude. The worst part of this experience is that I was the ONLY person there. Never have I felt so rushed when eating sushi. To make matters worse I got tired of getting rushed so I told the sushi chef I was done ordering. Next thing I know the chef pulls out his phone takes off his cap and goes sits in a corner. I have to give a real review of the restaurant so it will stay at 4/5 star ratings. If I was rating on customer service alone. This review would have been a 2/5 star rating.

This place has became my favorite sushi ayce place in town. Great service and great food. I couldn't ask for more. Ladies serving us are very friendly. AYCE menu has a good selection of appetizer, nigiri, and sushi roll. All the food we order tastes great with good presentation.

Another decent AYCE spot. This one takes over the space formerly occupied by 808 Tapas. Hanabi has a fairly large menu with some items only available a la carte. Nigiri is the way to go here. The quality is pretty good for an AYCE place. Rolls on the other hand weren't my favorite. Some, like the yellowtail special with cooked shrimp, jalapeÃ±o, cilantro, cucumber topped with yellowtail, ponzu, habanero, were too hot for my tastes. The Tiger roll (shrimp tempura, crab topped with spicy tuna with eel sauce) was the best of the bunch, the Mad Caterpillar (fresh water eel and cucumber topped with spicy tuna, spicy eel sauce) was decent, and the Crispy tuna scallion was not good with tuna that looked and tasted liked canned tuna. As a whole, the rolls seemed hastily crafted and lacked the precision of superior rolls found elsewhere.

2.5 Stars
The service was great.  Food was very good. The rolls are very good combinations. There is a mix of traditional sushi rolls with new rolls too. Will be going back.

The rice ratio isn't as good as other place but their quality outshines the ratio. Nothing tasted fishy and even the crab had good flavor. They didn't run out Uni like many other places in Vegas -_-. The service was great, everyone was super attentive and welcoming. Favorite roll was the Rock N Roll...no rice all fish :)

Hanabi is now my go-to sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. Chef Andy and his staff are all excellent. The rolls are inventive and tasty. The nigiri are perfectly proportioned and the sushi rice is excellently flavored and the perfect temperature. It goes without saying that the fish is excellent but the variety is also wonderful and exciting. The service is always very attentive and fast. I love this place and can't wait to return!  I prefer the sushi bar but it's also great for larger groups, too! I highly recommend all of my Las Vegas friends to go to Hanabi. You won't be disappointed!

I am not a huge of fan of all-you-can-eat sushi menus, but it's very common in Vegas.  However, I really enjoyed it here and would actually come back and do it again.  A friend and I checked this place out for the grand opening, and we really enjoyed the experience. Thanks Hanabi!  The restaurant has a sushi bar and modern bench style seating.  While Hanabi is located in a shopping center, it reminded me of trendy hot spots you'd find in bigger cities, which is cool to have in this area. 

The sushi was delicately and beautifully crafted (I know because we sat at the sushi bar and watched) into masterpieces that tasted as great as it looked. We were fortunate enough to see the owner, Andy, work his magic on most of our orders.  You can order nearly everything offered on the menu, including poke salad, soft shell crab, and oysters.  I was most impressed by how fresh the food was - like so fresh, you can nearly taste the ocean where it came from.  Because of the outstanding quality, I didn't feel like the rolls were heavy, but rather light and very satisfying.

My only disappointment is that we didn't make it to dessert. Honey toast, and all-you-can-eat... I shall be back!

BEST service and incredible people. This is our place for sushi. All you can eat and its delicious! Servers are so kind and nice. our Favorite rolls are the -bacon roll, alaskan roll, baja salsa roll. So many more!


This place is our weekly treat.

Just ate here for the fist time and we eat sushi once a week.   Did the AYCE and it was excellent!!  You must come here.   The sushi was so tender,  fresh and extremely well presented.   Everyone was nice and attentive.  Make sure you do not leave without having Mochi.   OMGOSH the best we've ever had.   So flavourful.   You will not be disappointed.

Let's be honest, everyone in this town is a sushi expert.

There are just a couple of rules you are going to have to follow if you want to roll out a new AYCE sushi bar in Las Vegas:

1 - Keep your prices competitive ($3+ more than everywhere else? Why?)
2 - Keep your fish fresh (if you cant sell it before it starts to turn, don't try to pass it on to unsuspecting customers)
3 - Don;t be cheap (buy sushi quality fish - believe me, we can tell the difference)
3 - Offer what everyone else does (if you wont serve me sashimi with AYCE, why should I come here?)
4 - Don't skimp on portions (look, stop being cheap, your fish is going rank, use it before it goes)

I will say it not the worst place I have tried in Vegas, but if I am paying piece meal instead of going AYCE, I expect you not to give my tiny little sliver of fish.

I'll be honest, the salmon tasted like crap. Sushi grade salmon doesn't taste like the cheap, color added, farmed raised crap you buy at Vons.

We are all sushi experts in this town - if you want to succeed, respect that.
Yummmy! I decided to try this place for lunch. I had the Spicy Tuna Bowl and it was delicious! The right amount of food and wasn't too spicy. I will be back.

Great location.  They greet every customer that walks in -huge points for enthusiasm.  Service was with a smile, timed perfectly and not overbearing.   Food also came out quickly and was very well portioned and presented.  Taste was "killer".  Highly recommend.  Compliments to the Chef and staff.  They all came off as appreciative of our visit.  Such a lost quality!!!

Great place for sushi.  I'm a no frills sushi gal, so the fish has got to be fresh.  It was delicious! Friendly staff.  Some nights of the week they have a saki by the bottle special, which is reason enough to go!
Great place good sushi... No intimidating menu clean. A little Gem if you are looking for Sushi on this side of town.
This place was excellent!! Chika & Su took such good care of us! Food was excellent too! Definitely will be back!! Loved this place!

One of the best sushi place in town 
Very recommended this place 
Grate customer service 
Very fast.........................
Sushi quality was great. Nice atmosphere and very comfortable chairs. Not the most creative rolls however, which is why we only have 4 stars. I would eat hear again though!

Ordered delivery through Eat24 and was so happy with the quality of food. 

Tuna Poke- so good but slightly smaller portion than other places, would still order again 

JalapeÃ±o poppers- loved!

Dynamite- dynamite! There's a lot of onions in it but I really like onions, the sauce is fantastic, I literally drank it odd my plate
Went here for a second time great fresh high quality food. Awesome service and friendly staff.

Originally a five star review until I went to the bathroom to change my sons diaper... no changing tables in either bathroom 

Crispy shrimp is boring don't get it 
The hot tea is disgusting, tastes like sesame oil 

Everything else was fantastic
Bulgogi, pork belly, miso soup, soft shell crab,
All delicious 
Burn my house & Macho roll were my favorite 
Great service, will definitely be back

This place was awesome! I got the all you can eat sushi for $28 and saved $24, and what's better, the sushi was fantastic tasting. The service was great too; snappy fast and polite. The owner was also walking around, cleaning up, taking orders and checking up on customers. Speaking of, I ordered takoyaki last second, and it wasn't even on the menu yet, and they made it quickly and it tasted great! Nice and creamy. Now, one of the the takoyaki was slightly, very slightly, cold in the center, which is understandable since I think I may have been one of the first, if not the first person to order it from them. When I told the owner so he could improve it in the future he apologized profusely and even said that he'd give one to me next time I came in! I'll come back next time I fly into Vegas, although it may be a couple of years....

Did AYCE tonight, it was delicious, portions were large, fish slices on all the sushis we ordered were nice and thick. We ordered the blue fin tuna(1 per guest), salmon and scallop sushi. All were tasty. But my favorite was they had Salmon Kama on their AYCE! It was my favorite! 8pc tempura combo was huge and done w/a perfect golden crunch. We also had salmon skin salad, animal specialty roll, and 2 orders of the agedashi tofu. It was sooo good! Service was nice, table service was very prompt, and the servers kept the table bre-bussed at all times. Drinks were filled at great timing....very happy we came & tried this spot! We will be back!! :)
Great sushi spot!!! Definitely try the 911 roll. It's a spicy tuna roll topped with avocado/ chili Mayo and franks hot red sauce! YUM!!! They had great service and the food came out fairly quick.

This place has only gotten better recently with one of the best Sushi chefs in town and new dishes.  It's the little things like pre cutting the baked green mussels and spending more time on each order to make it just right that make this place fantastic.  I've been to hundreds of sushi places around North America and this is one of the rare gems; low prices and quality fish!

Service was good but with little comments in their native tongue, food quality was ok. A couple of dishes were skeptical, was afraid to try the dark colored uni they served. Have had way better ACYE else in town. Go fish.

Found my new sushi spot! Great FRESH fish and very tasty looking menu (can't wait to go back and try more)!! Owner was extremely attentive and helpful in recommending rolls based on your likes/dislikes in regards to fish, spice tolerance, etc., even asking if we had any allergies to be aware of.  He used to work at Nobu and is now branching out in his own!! They were very accommodating as some of the rolls we were interested in were spicy and switched it out with something simply delicious that worked for us. Absolutely loved everything we ordered and wouldn't be surprised if there was something you could order that would actually be bad or even mediocre. Would recommend for sure. The owner obviously is passionate in putting his heart and soul into this business and he surely deserves success in all his hard work.

This was our first visit and we will definitely be back! We stumbled onto this place just walking around the plaza on a beautiful Saturday evening. We decided to give a try and were not disappointed! The sushi we had was awesome and we started with the edamame and it was a perfect meal!  the staff is very friendly and just an overall great gem!

Very excited that this new sushi place is so close to my house! It's small, but the decor is pretty nice. The restaurant looks a lot different than its previous incarnation (808 tapas), it looks a lot more modern and feels more spacious and open. 

The food itself is great. I am no sushi connoisseur, but have enjoyed everything that I have eaten from here. I mostly eat rolls (being pretty new to the sushi game) and the waitstaff has recommended some great options for me to order based on things I liked previously. My husband loves sushi, knows a lot more about it, and maintains that the quality of the food is great. He has taken advantage of the 28$ all you can eat offer, and it was a great deal for him. If you're hungry, it's the way to go! The staff brought the food out very quickly, I don't think they put any limit on how many items he could order at one time, and he ended up really pleased with the all you can eat deal. 

On two separate occasions the kitchen comped us appetizers, the spicy garlic edamame and a seaweed salad. Both were very good - I would expect a sushi place to slack a little on appetizer quality, but they did not. The cook also came out personally to talk to us once about our food, and he generally seems to care a great deal about the restaurant and quality of his food.

We've brought friends here a few times and have been really pleased with the atmosphere, price, service and food.

Andy and his staff are amazing. Most sushi restaurants greet you with an enthusiastic "welcome" in Japanese, but at Hanabi you truly feel welcome.  The care placed into every dish is apparent both in flavor and presentation. I personally love sashimi and not every place gets sashimi right either because of their fish quality or because they over season the fish -Andy and his team let the fish speak for itself with clean and elegant flavors.  There is an extensive list of rolls, soups, salads, entrees and appetizers. Did I mention the miso soup? If you like miso get it here -you won't regret it.  They offer a dessert menu with mochi, ice cream, honey toast and green tea cheesecake....but the true star here is the fish flown in fresh from all over the world!  Just ask Andy about the daily catch and savor each bite.

This place is awesome. It is always sparkling clean and the staff is incredibly friendly, eager to help. Often times the owner is on hand and he loves to meet and get to know his customers.

Well they're sitting at tables or at the bar you will receive fantastic service every single time. I love their nigiri options, and their roles are also fantastic. They recently started offering tonkatsu ramen which I cannot wait to try. I love that they offer fresh oysters. The authors are huge and absolutely scrumptious and come served on ice with lemon. We love the simply shrimp, crazy caterpillar, loco mojo, and red rock rolls. Customizations are available upon request.

We here frequently with friends, probably once every two weeks. We love the consistency we always know what we're going to get when it comes to quality. When it comes to sushi surprises aren't always a good thing.

During my birthday week we came here tonight's in a row because it that good. Hanabi is one of our favorite sushi restaurants in the city and we will be back time and time again.

Good spot for AYCE sushi. HUGE selection, the entire menu is available on the AYCE so there's stuff for everyone to eat. The Mona Lisa roll was great. My only two complaints would be that the cucumbers are cut way to big and also it's weird that you can only get one item for dessert. You would think that they wouldn't mind giving you two scoops of ice cream since maybe you will fill up on cheap ice cream instead of expensive fish. But besides that it was great. Nice,clean, bright, and modern.

Tossed between a 3 and 4 rating on this one. Good all you can eat is hard to find and this place did not disappoint. Lots of rolls and appetizers to choose from.

We like the garlic tuna and salmon nigiri a lot. The Mona Lisa was a definite as well as the white dragon

Wow!!! First of all, the restaurant is beautiful. As soon as you walk in your greeted & seated. The Staff is amazing! Ok....The Sushi & food is by far the best in Vegas that we've tried.  Very tasty, the fish is fresh & prepared beautifully. Our orders were coming in so quick, that is awesome! I, as well as my Husband give this place 5 stars & we will return for more! It's been a long time since I've had a combo of the best "Customer service & Food/Fish", this place hands down is GREAT!

Overall the place was pretty average. Long story short, the appetizers were awesome, the sushi was subpar, and the desert was horrible. The place was really loud too. The prices are also more expensive than other all you can eats and too many items are a la carte only.

Long story long, read on.

First, the restaurant itself. It has a nice, modern, clean vibe and look to it. The staff were friendly. One complaint was the music was way too loud. It was hard to have a normal conversation without raising our voices, so we kindly asked if they could turn the volume down. Instead, the waitress asked if we wanted to move to a different table. Since the volume level is pretty much the same no matter where you are there, that perplexed us and we stayed put. 

Prices are steeper here. Lunch is $22 and dinner is $28. That's $3 more than average. Several items are a la carte only that are typically included at other all-you-can-eat places (albiet often one order only), though that have some special items that justify it like real kobe beef. House sake was also $6 for a small and $9 for a large, which is also about $3 more expensive than other places. Note that there is a 2 for 1 deal for sake or beer if you check in on Yelp, so that helps.

Onto the food. They have a decent variety of appetizers, including some with enoki mushrooms which you don't usually see. We tried a wide variety of them and everything was well prepared, well portioned, and delicious. The tempura based items were particularly tasty. We were happy campers so far.

Our nigiri sushi orders came out and our enthusiasm dropped. The quality of the fish was fairly good, but the pieces were fairly small, and the fish was cut very thin. They were about 90% rice and 10% fish. The rolls we received were also pretty stingy with the fish as the cuts on top were equally thin, and the fish inside was small compared to the other filler items. When compared to places like Sakana or Sasa who are very generous with their fish portions, it was very disappointing.

After getting full on mostly rice, we asked for dessert. This is when things got pretty dire. I got the vanilla ice cream with macaroons, and my friends got green tea and strawberry mochi. My ice cream was partially translucent and looked more like a sorbet, like it was dairy free. Worst vanilla ice cream ever. The macaroon also tasted kind of like garlic, which was really strange. I'm guessing it had been stored next to it and the garlic flavor creeped in. The green tea mochi was horrid. The rice covering was crumbly and had a rough texture. The ice cream was neon yellowish green, had a weird texture, and tasted funny. The strawberry mochi was better at least, but not great.

One other minor gripe was with the men's bathroom. The urinal wouldn't flush, and the toilet paper felt like it was from 1970's Soviet Russia. At least it was clean.

The staff were friendly and attentive outside of the issue with the loud music, and one of the chefs personally said goodbye to us as we were walking out.

We give it a 2 1/2 out of 5. Definitely not the worst place I've been to, but there's definitely room to improve, and there much better places like Sasa and Sakana, which are also cheaper. If they do a better job with fish portions, desserts, bring the prices down a bit, and turn the music down, we'll be keen to return. Until then we'll stick with Sasa and Sakana as our main places.
Excellent food and quick service! Rolls are prepared with care and fish is very fresh. They have a good selection of rolls, and the AYCE is cheap and generous in terms of menu options.

I absolutely love this place! All you can eat sushi (with the best vegetarian specialty roll/appetizer I have ever seen). They also have all you can drink (sake and beer) for $15... But I'm not sure for how much longer. 
My meat eating friends love it too for variety of options, both sushi and hot.
Sarah is my favorite server. The sushi chefs are also happy to help you figure out what you want or make suggestions.
I bring all my friends here. Splitting the check is easy and everyone leaves full and happy.

I should stop trying new sushi places, and stick to my tried and true. 

Easily my worst sushi experience in Las Vegas. The space itself isn't bad with a clean decor and friendly service. The fail all comes with the quality of the sushi and the combinations in the rolls here. Typically when i do AYCE sushi i am 90% nigiri and 10% rolls. After placing my traditional 90/10 order for the first round, the quality made me want to order rolls to cover up the sub par quality of the fish. I found myself not even wanting to eat some of the nigiri but i felt as if i had to as to not get charged extra for it in the end. Second round was more rolls than anything was also a disappointment because there was just so much sauce, a mess of combinations, and flavor that didn't resemble anything delicious. After paying the bill i felt cheated to be honest, as i felt like i was fed something i didn't want and was forced to pay for it. A terrible feeling if you were hoping to go out for a nice dinner. I am trying to understand the positive reviews here as i didn't experience anything close to what others have said.
Phenomenal atmosphere and amazing sushi. I enjoy going and eating the all you can eat. Without a doubt one of my favorite sushi restaurants.

This is a good cozy place. Very clean and always have the friendliest attentive staff, only thing I can say is I wish they had more variety in their rolls but other than that good AYCE place if you live in the summerlin area. Also next to the theatre!
The sushi here was really fresh. Larger selection of nigiri and hot dishes than a lot of other places. Definitely going to be my new spot!

I've been looking for a new sushi place since leaving sushimon and goyemon is a bit far. Hanabi was a great find. My son and I had the all you can eat at the sushi bar. My son is pretty particular about what he gets (he's 13) but he has his regulars. He loves salmon on salmon. The chef said it wasn't on the menu but was glad to make it for him. Then, we had a whole bunch of nigiri sushi. The Terry Roll was really good. All the fish was top quality. I learned that the head chef had been at Nobu. The uni was delicious. I love that you can get softshell crab by itself, although, I thought the sauce was too much. I made a mental note to order it without the sauce next time. Their shrimp tempura was good. We ordered it twice. The first time it wasn't crispy enough and the second time it was perfect. 
We were in and out in 35 minutes, full, and knew we'd come back. 
The service is friendly and attentive. We liked it!

This place is mine and my wife's new favorite place.  The waitress is super friendly, they are ridiculously quick with the orders (less than 2 minutes some times).  Quality is great and there are so many delicious appetizer plates.  I recommend the all you can eat, its the best deal.

I really like the sushi. The rolls are a bit smaller than other places but its only that they don't surround the sushi with a half inch of rice. In other words, much more flavor. Also, it was the quickest I've ever got sushi. EVER! Ordered edamame with the sushi and the sushi came seconds after the edamame. The edamame came quickly. Anyway, great flavors, very hospitable service and a great array of choices. You really should give it a go. It's now my sushi spot.

Just ok. Not sure how people are giving this place 5 starts. Although this is AYCE, the fish cuts are subpar. The wasabi was bland. Many of the rolls were drowning in sauce.  Can't think of even one memorable dish to mention. They do provide frosty cold mugs with beret though. Service was friendly and fast which was the only saving grace.

I've been here a few times now. Every time we come service has been a bit slow. It was so slow the last time that we went that another table cancelled their order. They only had one server and 2 sushi chefs during the lunch rush...at least I don't think I saw anyone in the kitchen. I believe the owner came in a hour after we were seated and he started helping out so it was a little quicker. 

Overall, the fish is good. There's a good selection of cooked and raw items.  You can also order half rolls. There's all you can drink sake as well. I liked the food and thought it was a good choice for AYCE. The benches are a bit uncomfortable so I would try and grab a seat at the bar if you can. I would definitely come back more often if the service was a little better, but sometimes you can overlook that if you have a lot of time on your hands.

We were in the area and came here because of the high review rating. A little underwhelmed, but good spot if you want a quick sushi fix. It's not bad, but it's not great either, I'd rather go to a more high quality sushi spot to fill your craving. 

We had a-la cart: 
-Coco Shrimp Roll: Yum!
-King Crab Miso: Yum!
-Tiger: Good
-Korean BBQ: Good, but some pieces were just fat
-Agedashi Tofu: Yum!

I can understand why the sushi runs a little small- for the AYCE customers. Great prices, we came when there was a 50% off roll special. Servers were friendly, but I feel like one was new so she was a bit scattered. The place was average, probably won't come back...
My wife and I absolutely love this place. We stop by once or twice a month. The staff remembers us. Clean. Delicious food. Great service. However, it's super cold in there. Bring a jacket!

Always consistently good food. Always consistently good service. I've ordered delivery and gone it and it's always great. I love their rolls, every one I've tried. I feel like it's very consistent no matter who is sushi master for the night. They're not super pricey, which is nice too. Great spot and a must try

I had AYCE the other day. The food I order was totally different than the picture from Yelp. The nigiri only about one lady finger big which was quite cute. The roll only has about a nail big fish inside of it. Only things I feel good with was the curry and honey toast.

Las Vegas has sushi places everywhere, but this was the best we've ever had!!  Sushi was fresh and service was fast and friendly.  As soon as we sat down, the server asked if we wanted water to start with.  She also suggested sushi rolls which were popular.  We ordered the "buy one get one free" sake special with a beer (which they suggested).  When we asked for the "free sake" they told us that the beer would cost extra (which other places do not do).  We ordered honey toast for dessert, but they ran out.  The chef came out and personally suggested a dessert which was delicious!! We are definitely coming back and have found a new "regular spot" to eat at!!

I came in here for lunch earlier today and I must say I was very impressed, I think I found my sushi spot on this side of town. I'm pretty picky with    sushi, but I really enjoyed this place. 

The fish was fresh and for an AYCE portion it was pretty good, not to small and not too much rice like some places do for AYCE! The garlic sauce was definitely my favorite, between y'all and I I'd drink it. 

Their special rolls were good but not great, however I only tried 2 cause I got pretty full. But I do expect to be back as there are a few more rolls that caught my eye, that I'm pretty excited to try!
Very tasty Asian tapas style options. I always have the butter enoki and my wife loves the scallop special. For dessert, their honey toast is bomb!
Been here a few times and it's been great quality for the price! Very extensive menu and good service

This brand new restaurant's interior was so modern. Servers were very pleasure and friendly. Appetizers were so great. The sushi was so fresh. I cant believe they r using uncommon food such as toro, alaskan kingcrab, madai. I never seen those food in local restaurants. If you really like sushi, this place is no brainer.

The service was great here for the most part. The sushi from the AYCE was really small and the bluefin tuna did not taste like bluefin tuna at all. Also, one waitress (middle age) was kind and attentive and always took my order fast (she deserves five stars) then a younger guy comes and takes my order and I said "2 orders of salmon and 2 orders of salmon roe" while pointing to the order. I saw him write down salmon roll but thought it's just how he remembers it..the waitress brought out the order and immediately asked if I ordered the salmon roe (I had done the same order like 4x with her before this) and she immediately took it back and came back with the right order. The dude who made the mistake kept saying in his language which I interpret it to mean "oh salmon roe not salmon roll, ikura not salmon roll). Wasn't even the least bit apologetic and when he came back with the order he low key snidely said "salmon and IKURA". Like bro 1. it says on your own menu salmon roe. 2. Don't ever think that the customer is wrong 3. Really pissed me off with his attitude. So in conclusion, nice joint with good waitresses but Small sushis( they do have a pretty extensive ayce menu though).
Good value, good quality, good service!  I'm not typically a fan of AYCE sushi, but this one hit the spot.
This place is my new favorite sushi place! Such a cute environment with great customer service and delicious food.

Amazing!!
Super fresh! Super yummy!! The eel was the best eel I've ever had in my life. Service was friendly and fast. This is my new favorite sushi place.

Came in craving for Udon soup but ended up doing AYCE. For the entire month of October their AYCE is only $19.99. But I would come back and pay regular price. The sushi was really good and the fish was really FRESH. All the side dishes were delicious also. The kitchen was little backed up but no biggie all the food came out hot. Come check them out especially during this promo.

Decent AYCE spot. Restaurant is nice, service was good no complaints. The food was everything you would expect from an AYCE. they have the standard fish selection. Tuna, bluefin tuna, (i call BS on that one. Ive worked with bluefin and the tuna we had was definitely Ahi. Still good though). White tuna AKA escolar, snapper, and yellowtail. They offer a nice buttery scallop, but limited to 1 per order. The hot apps were not as good as some other places that ive been to. The soft shell crab was severly overcooked. The mussels were ok, but still really overcooked. The tempura was well fried. They offer hamachi collar, which i usually like to order, but there was a $4 upcharge for that item so we passed. All in all a decent  AYCE sushi, just as good as most AYCE. they are having a promotion right now for $20. So the price is definitely worth it.
Great food, terrific service, clean & new.  If you like spicy follow my lead, spicy garlic edamame, Andy's Special, 911 & Baja Salsa!

The AYCE was a great deal.   The service was wonderful.  Andy kept checking to make sure everything was to our liking.  All the sushi tasted fresh and was well prepared.   The tuna and salmon were particularly fresh and tasty.   The soft shell crab was done to perfection.  Was not a fan of the beef teriyaki or the bacon mushroom that someone ordered but cannot mark them down since generally I do not order those dishes when I go to sushi.

We've eaten here 3x by invitation of friends and had mediocre to good experience. Last visit was the worst and the final straw for us. Went on a Wednesday night for dinner and there was only ONE other table that had people. That's it. To start with they brought us their order.  No biggie. 
But then I ordered salmon poke. It was overly spicy and fishy tasting. No where on the menu does it says that it's spicy! Then we asked for gluten-free soy sauce and fresh wasabi- we were told the wasabi is $3 extra charge and said OK. In addition the two regular rolls that I ordered had a ridiculous amount of rice and very little fish inside. Upon receiving our bill we were charged FIVE dollars for the fresh wasabi and $2 for the gluten-free soy sauce! Are you kidding me? We paid because we couldn't wait to get out of there. The chairs are uncomfortable with no backrest, and the music is loud and obnoxious. They need to get their act together if they want to last. The entire hour we were there there was only one other table that filled up.

This place is great. So good, I went twice in one week. 

Last Saturday, my friend and I were meeting in that area of town for lunch and to get piercings. We were both ravenous, so AYCE sushi was the obvious answer. I checked Yelp and Hanabi had fabulous reviews. We are around 4:30 in the afternoon, and the place was empty. But that just lead to an amazing experience. We chose to sit at the bar and the ladies who manage the bar were prompt, polite, and gave great recommendations. When I went for myself second visit, we sat at a table, but our experience was just as good. Our waiter was so nice, gave great recommendations, and even let us get away with using our one per person to order two of the same thing for one person. 

When it comes to food, everything was so fresh, creative, and the presentation was amazing. Their sashimi was the perfect portions and they have lots of non sushi items too, so this place is great if you want to check it out with a non raw fish eater. You have to try the Sushi Bomb roll, the Sunset roll, Animal Style roll, and the Mona Lisa Roll. The CocoSalmon roll was also very creative and good.

This place is a hidden gem in Village Square and if your a fan of delicious flavor, you should check them out!
The fish is surprisingly fresh. I'm a little bit of a sushi snob. And this place has my official  for all you can eat sushi in the dessert. Service was also fantastic. Thanks youngeoo!

I'm happy to say that there is new sushi bar in town which has a great all you can eat option. Luckily we were passing by on their first day of business so we decided to give it a try! I was originally just looking for some appetizers to snack on but the all you can eat dinner for 28.00 seemed pretty reasonable so I went with the all you can eat. 

I started with the Kobe beef sushi roll. It had Kobe beef, avocado and a sweet type of sauce drizzled on the top. It was delicious! 

The crispy buffalo shrimp was tangy . They were bite sized shrimp with buffalo flavoring. 

The 007 was like a California roll but with big pieces of shrimp and avocado draped over the rolls. I enjoyed these as well!

Bacon and scallop skewers were mostly bacon with tiny pieces of scallops inside. They had different skewers available . I would like to try the bacon and mushroom skewers next time. 

Chicken Katsu wraps were good especially for people like my husband who don't eat sushi. He was happy with the wrap and his cucumber salad .

We ended the meal with some honey toast. It reminded me of hawaiian rolls with ice cream and honey on the top. It  was my first time having this dessert be prepared for sweetness overload!

I liked the variety on the menu and that there wasn't a lot that was left out of the all you can eat. Except for the sashimi but it was okay with me because I don't eat sashimi. I thought the picnic type of chairs were cute and comfortable. The service was on point and I can't wait to go back. My husband even found something he would like to try on our next visit!

Who would have thought that this small place in in Regal Village is a hidden gem. One of the best AYCE sushis I've had. The fact that this place is walking distance from me is a plus! It seems that they have more unique rolls in their menu and more dessert options than your usual AYCE place! Price is reasonable, clean, great service!

Let's see:

Maui Roll - My personal favorite. I love garlic ponzu on everything.

Tiger Roll - Bomb!

Korean BBQ Roll - Wasn't too impressed, it was ok

Tempura ice cream - Yummmmy

Honey bread - Bomb!

Yes, I've been here 3 times now. If I could, I would eat here every weekend!

I think I might have found my new favorite sushi spot! Hanabi is located in Village Square right by Archie's and Cold Stone. It's a little bit small inside, but nicely decorated. It has a very modern, urban feel. 

Now for the best part, the sushi.. OMG. So good! Our favorite roll was the Coco Salmon. The salmon literally melts in your mouth and the coconut flavor is just right, not too over powering. Definitely 5/5. Our next favorite was the Sunset roll. I could not get enough of the creamy sauce on that one, another 5/5. The final roll we got was the Mona Lisa. This one was still very tasty, but a little bit too much cream cheese for me. I'd have to say 4/5. The ginger salad was also tasty. It was pretty standard, but a large portion size. 

I cannot wait to come back here again and try out some more rolls. Honestly the best, freshest fish around!

I noticed this new sushi place while I was going to eat at Archie's next door. I decided to come back and try the new AYCE sushi spot.

I was very happy with the quality of the food and the presentation. They have a large selection of rolls to choose from on their menu. The service was a little slow, but I realized it was because they made everyone's rolls at the table at one time and put them on one large serving plate. I will ask them not to do that next time.

The only dish I did not care for was the honey toast. They served us a roll with ice cream and honey. If you want good honey toast, go to Ichiza in China Town.

I would definitely recommend eating here. It's a few dollars more per person than other AYCE places around town, but it was worth it.

Amazing sushi best in Vegas! 
Great quality,fresh tasting unbelievable service!
Presentation is beautiful!

This was our first time at Hanabi restaurant and we were very disappointed with their services.  Their foods however was very good but we had to wait for a very long time for the foods to arrive,  a little later that evening either the owner or the manager came over to us and showed his concerned to make sure we were okay,  I did tell him that it was unusual to wait so long for the foods.  My son did not get a straw with his drinks.  We were there on Tuesday evening around 7 pm so it was even crowded, and because it took a long time to get out foods,  we didn't get out of there close to 9 pm.  If had their services was great they would have gotten 5 stars.  We will unlikely be going back again.  Since it was my wife's birthday,  they didn't have any candles and yes we know it is not the restaurant's responsibility but it would have been nice if they had candles as well.

Great presentation. Wonderful service! Food is so yummy! The best part was how the distribution of rice and fish in the sushi was! Perfect! The deep fried soft shell crab was so good with the miso paste with some kick to it. I also enjoyed the Korean short rib! The best! Will come back again definitely!

Hanabi is great lil place. Food was fresh and service was excellent. Very clean and efficient. The portions and prices are nice as well. I recommend the spicy octopus. It was delicious. They have AYCE as well. I wish they would have a weekday happy hour. Would be fun to try a few sake. ;)
This place has excellent service. Always clean and welcoming. Owner Andy make us feel welcome every time.  The food is always  fresh and delicious.

The chicken hibachi plate is amazing.  I don't what the seasoning is.  And the house ginger salad is really good.   I want to find  a recipe for the salad dressing.  The service is good and the music is fun.   Perfect place for a late lunch.  Fun atmosphere.

They served us warm oysters.....that alone should tell the entire story, BUT if you want to know more, the quality of the fish is only average.  They give you REALLY tiny pieces which makes you think that its ok because then you get to try more, but then you suddenly realize, you're practically just eating rice because the fish is cut so thin and small you aint eating JACK SHIT.

I'm so glad I found this place! It's new in the area and my daughter and I found it by accident. We eat a lot of sushi and it's close by. The place has an urban modern feel, everyone is very friendly and seems genuinely happy to see you! We ordered yellowtail sashimi. Very fresh. We had a few different rolls, also very fresh and delicious. The service was fantastic so we decided to try the recommended desert of Honey Toast and it was unlike anything I have ever had. I will order it every time. There were many food and drink specials to choose from, we will make this one of our regular spots and look forward to exploring the entire menu.

Awesome new place! Fresh sushi and a great menu! We had all you can eat and a bottle of wine. Took our time and tried a bunch of items. Everything was tasty and super fresh! Will definitely be coming back as a regular.

I'm so for real when I say that if you haven't been to HANABI  you MUST!! The food is so delicious! We generally only go to a few places when it comes to sushi and we finally found a gem - the fish is so buttery and flavorful - we love everything!! Garlic yellowtail - garlic tuna - yellowtail special - tuna poke - just name some items - Also , to sweeten up the deal, they have a "daily sashimi special" so everyday it's different sashimi special- only two pieces but it's very premium - They have honey toast for dessert which is always a joy no matter where it's being served - This place is truly something great - CHECK IT OUT!
Great sushi place for lunch. Have an all you can eat option but prefer ordering from the menu. The crunchy California roll was my favorite. Good miso soup

They say the Japanese eat with their eyes.  A lot of that comes through in sushi preparation and service.  You want your nigiri to be sharply prepared, with tight rice and well cut and presented fish.  When you take the piece in your hand or your sticks, the entire nigiri should be as one piece - a combination of visual flavor and delicious colors.

This was a second choice for us tonight, since our usual sushi joint was overflowing with customers and had a 1 hour wait.  There is a reason for that.

When we arrived at Hanabi, there was no wait.  Indeed, this is usually a positive, but in a foodie town like Vegas, this sometimes means that the fare simply does not match up to a discerning palate, and the punters go elsewhere.

I wish the presentation was better, but I can deal with that as long as the food is good.  Unfortunately the sushi tasted less than fresh, and this was especially apparent in the mackerel, the tuna and the salmon nigiri - all of which are especially unforgiving of poor preparation and in which freshness is paramount.  You can understand why I did not want to try any of the rolls, which are usually designed to mask bad fish behind heavy sauces and creamy bases.  The nigiri had a paucity of quality fish, overwhelmed by too much under-seasoned rice underneath.

The servers were attentive but frequently intrusive - standing around very close by while we tried to enjoy the meal.  Unfortunately, they had to go back to the chef's station multiple times to check on overdue orders that I asked for but only sometimes received.  It did not help that the chef seemed to be more focused on supervising and guiding a trainee or novice chef instead of getting orders out promptly.

Hanabi is a laudable effort but it doesn't work in this part of town.  Unfortunately, all the empty chairs on a normally busy night bodes poorly for this spot.  808 Tapas also did not fare well for the same reason - it could be the unforgiving location with high rents, but also the picky customers in Summerlin.  The Grand Opening sign in December when the restaurant has been open since June also is topic for a laugh.

I wish them well but there's a long way to go to be successful.

My recommendations:

1. Lower your AYCE prices by 10-15% immediately in order to stay competitive.
2. Add Happy Hour specials to include generous drinks along with the food - they don't have to be expensive drinks, well-grade sake is more than enough.
3. Groupon all day every day.
4. You need to get a better sushi fish purveyor.  Something is not right about the nigiri and the sashimi.
5. Include sashimi in the AYCE.
6. Loyalty program to keep the locals coming - buy 4 AYCE and get next one free.
Great ambience great service. The price was really good...sushi was fresh...will come here again...

Was heading to Thai restaurant next door, Saw this place and decide to give a try...

Employee's family member (aka kids) play in group within restaurant while we dinning. Loud noise just doesn't mix well with dinner.

Either owner allow or so, however church functions just don't belong within restaurant during dinner time.

Sushi rice should be blended with chef's special vinegar mix, instead just stander cal-rose rice which fall apart when pick up every time. Tempura batter bit thick and not really crunchy. 

Imitation crab is bit over use, I mean over pile inside or on just about every rolls, and over power by sauces. We can not even taste the fishes. 

All and all decal is nice, services is great.. Food needs lots help!!

The food was extremely was good. I would recommend this place to a friend for sure. The appetizer was good, the main course was good, but I don't think I have room for dessert. Maybe we can get some another time. 

Thanks again, including the server was very good!! 
Thanks, Josh.
By far the best all you can eat sushi in Vegas. The fish to rice portion was on point as well as the quality and freshness of the fish... I would most definitely come here again.

They must have lowered their AYCE price because the check in price on the Yelp app is the same as the menu so you aren't getting a deal by checking in on yelp. No real complaints about this place, the bench style seating was good and so was the Honey Toast dessert! The sushi was just average, nothing super special about it. Probably won't go back again though because Sushi Koma tastes better and is the same price if not cheaper.

The best sushi I have ever had. The owner Andy & manager Chris are the nicest most honest people I've met! They were very inviting even though they were going to close. Did not feel rush at all. Very modern with a traditional taste. They took the time to get to know us and my daughter. Great with kids! This is my go to spot now.
