I've been here 5 times and enjoyed it every time. The AYCE is great and affordable. Service is attentive. I will keep coming here for consistency. I have nothing negative to say at all.

Two words: Cucumber Salad.
That dish alone was a work of art. If that 1 item was delicious, you know you're in for a treat for the rest of the menu :)

Great place. Staff very friendly. I would highly recommend. Halibut fin(engawa) so good. The sushi master are the best! Thank you everyone at hanabi for a great experience. I really enjoyed my time there. Best hang out spot.

Update: we used to come here all the time because the food was so good; better than anywhere else, but we came here for dinner tonight and it was terrible. I mean some of the food, was so bad I almost threw up in my mouth. The tuna in tuna poke was frozen & the texture was not right. 
We won't be coming here again.

Tried this place tonight! Chill atmosphere with lots of tables equipped for large parties and they had tv's too! So it's a good spot to watch games as well. I didn't do ayce because I wasn't planning on getting a lot of raw fish and I feel like it's worth it when you order sushi/sashimi. 

Clam miso soup: 5/5 great flavor. Didn't taste like it was made out of instant powder. Came with enoki mushrooms, yumm. And the bowl had about 5 Manila clams. $3.50

Sunset roll: 3.5/5 spicy tuna roll with salmon on top drizzled with a sauce that tasted like spicy mayo. They used too much sauce in my opinion and the salmon on top was skimpy. But each piece was a perfect bite size which I liked. $12

Hamachi Kama: 4.5/5 smelled a little fishy but it was soft and tender! $9

Gyoza: 4.5/5 

Habachi steak: 3.5/5 had an interesting sauce that I cannot describe. But I smelled butter and I'm not a fan of that. The steak itself was ok, not that tender. It was a good portion though.

I'm actually rather disappointed in my experience here.  I was super excited when my brother and I sat down.  Especially since the service seems to be great at the very beginning.  The waitresses were very kind.  But it was like a train wreck.  Through the entire experience, they forgot what we order, gave it to the wrong table, we had to re-order.  It was a hot mess.  My brother and I honestly gave up.  We did the AYCE special for $20.  We were there for about an hour and a half, literally an hour was us waiting for our food that never came.  Which honestly was REALLY annoying.  There were even times when the entire staff was arguing because a to-go order was misplaced.  Honestly, the entire experience was so bad, I would NEVER come again.  The reason why I gave it a two instead of a one is because the waitress were honestly nice people.  The entire overall experience was TERRIBLE.  

I would comment on the food, but I can't even remember eating anything because they barely gave us anything.  

Spent $50 on sushi, ended up getting a front-row seat to a live reality TV on Korean workers' drama at a sushi restaurant.  I usually go to Drama Fever for me Korean drama, but I guess not this time.
We've brought our whole family here twice a month since it opened. The cuts of fish are fresh, and the rolls well prepared. We like the clean decor and attentive service.

Very good overall. A better experience than many OYCE sushi places that I visited last year. The Oyster and sashimi were fresh and delicious. I liked most of the rolls I ordered; the only one that I didn't like was the Korean BBQ roll, which was too fatty. They need to trim the meat better. Will be back soon.

Loved it so much, we came back the second night. First night was Wife, 4 year old, toddler, uncle, aunt, and I for dinner after the indoor playground across the parking lot around 6 on the Saturday of memorial weekend. There were about 4 open tables and a few seats at the bar, so we were seated immediately. The wait staff was incredibly friendly and attentive and knew we were there to feast on some AYCE. 

My kids love Udon noodles so we ordered them with the drink order and they were very content slurping them up off their plates while the grown ups enjoyed a buffet of nigiri and rolls. The fish to rice ratio on the nigiri is slightly more than what you would expect to get for $25 AYCE. 

On the Sunday night of memorial weekend, we made reservations for 10 people around 6 and met up for another round of "stuff yourself silly with sushi." This time around we tried a bunch of appetizers in addition to nigiri and rolls. The staff was excellent again. Definitely on the list of places to suggest when figuring out where to eat.

Love this place! Bright and cozy atmosphere. Friendly staff with plenty of comfortable seating. Great specials everyday. I keep coming back for more! Great variety of options. You won't be disappointed if you stop by.

I took my brother here a week after National Sibling Day lol. The sushi was fresh. The Chef was friendly amusing and full of positive energy. I need to go back because my review is written way after I ate there.

My girlfriend and I love this spot, soon as you walked in, it felt clean and cozy with plenty of lighting and fun little benches that were outside the usual chairs which gave the spot a lot more room than it seems. 

The staff and chefs were happy to greet you at first glance and say goodbye once you were all ready to leave. Though they did have an all you can eat for a time limit deal, we opted in for single rolls as we werent as hungry to destroy as much after a movie and popcorn that hour prior. We started off with the 007 and loved it, fresh, creamy. Then did something a little more spicy with our favorite ingrediant; avocado and what seemed like a tobasco/hot wing sauce appropriately named the 911. I'm a spice guy myself so it was well received.

After that, we enjoyed the heated Snow White roll that melted in our mouth and was clearly our favorite. The service was top notch and they were quick on the drink refills without a single issue. We stayed talking for a bit and although most places seemed pushy after a meal, they were happy enough to keep asking to refill our drinks, which was refreshing. We give this grand opening a great review because it was great service, great food and not too bad on the price for great atmosphere and a clean establishment. 

Thanks for the good stuff, highly recommended, though go hungry for the All-you-can-eat as you'll definitely want to try out most of their great combinations.

Was there last night for dinner. Walked in and was surprised at the atmosphere. It was very nice and and quaint. Although I was quite cold because they kept the place pretty chilly. We opted for the AYCE option which was more than worth it. They have a couple of interesting appetizers that we tried. One of the was the monkey brain or something to that effect. It was like tempura fried avocado but it was tasty. Sushi was unique and fresh. I had the red tiger roll and the baja roll. Red tiger was a spicier version of a typical tiger roll. The baja was a play on a special roll with addition of cilantro. Also tried the coco salmon roll which was interesting and almost sweet. Ended with a dish they called honey toast. It was tasty but only if it was warm because that's what I expected. Service was good granted we were the only ones in the place at a point. I would go back because I felt the AYCE was a good value for what they offered.

Great new spot for sushi and other dishes.  Very solid menu, owner was a great person and very informative and friendly.  Very clean and for the quality of food it was a amazing price.  Rock and Roll roll was awesome.  Wish I would have bought the Beef Tataki or the Kobe beef.  Next time for sure!

The super white tuna was spoiled, and smelled as such. I didn't eat my order of two pieces and let the waitress know it was spoiled. She just smiled and said ok and took the plate away. I was shocked and repeated that it was spoiled, my intention being that others shouldn't be served that fish. She just shrugged and walked away. Very bad look for the restaurant. The rest of the food was pretty good too!
I ordered delivery. Shrimp tempura was greasy. Tiger and dragon roll absolutely not worth 12.00 each. The worst!

The wee little lady who looks like Dora the explorer crossed over with dragon ball z, she was super rude about everything. Even simple questions such as anyway we can add tuna to something. And the fact that everyone at the table ordered all you can eat and we couldn't share. It's all bullshit.
This was my first time here and could not have been more satisfied. Good quality food and great service. All around great experience. Will come again soon!

Checked it out for dinner with friends since it was the closest AYCE sushi spot. I'm on the fence about this place. For now, I will give this place a 3. It wasn't the best, nor was it the worst. Just meh.

We were acknowledged and greeted promptly as we walked through the door.  The restaurant was loud, lively,  and was about at 50% capacity for a dinner time. Not too bad. We informed the hostess there was three in our party and lead quickly to a 4-top. I went to the restroom to wash my hands and came back to my party with only place settings and menus for two..  I corrected it myself by grabbing from the table next to us. Aside from that little hiccup,  service was quick and they were attentive. I never had to ask for a refill on my beverages. 

Pricing was good for an AYCE. $24.99. But very confusing. Why put on Yelp! that to check in the price is $24.99 when the price is already that to begin with? I thought the draw for businesses using Yelp! was to for an incentive for visiting their establishment?

My qualifications for an AYCE restaurant are very minimal: 
- fresh ingredients, mainly their uni and amaebi
- is their salmon skin hand roll actually crispy and mostly salmon skin?
- do they have natto?
- do they carry fresh wasabi?

Their uni was very fresh. Firm and no bad aftertaste. Same with amaebi. The downside to their amaebi is the puny size and no tempura heads to accompany the nigiri. 

Their salmon skin hand roll should really be considered a salmon handroll as there was more salmon than fried skin. Taste was fine and as always I forget to ask no eel sauce. I'm very picky to menu items; don't list something if it's not what you are presenting the guest. While we are on this topic, please don't say that you have soft shell crab on the menu and only give half of the soft shell crab. I understand it is only 1 per guest on AYCE, but at least specify it's half of the soft shell. I'll gladly pay for a full crab.

Natto was not on the menu from what I saw, but they did carry it. Down side, they were out! I get that it is a Tuesday and they were closed Monday, but it's a Tuesday... deliveries should have been made to compensate for a busy weekend if they were running low, so that was a let down.

Seeing as they were not up to par with my necessities for sushi, I opted to not inquire about fresh wasabi.

Dessert menu offered the nornal sushi staple: tempura ice cream and mochi ice cream. Nothing made the desserts stand out or scream out.

But definitely willing to give them a chance again.

What a perfect experience. The food and service were both remarkable, and the owner (Andy) and his staff made our spontaneous family sushi night one to be relaxed and enjoyed. Looking forward to our next visit - but maybe next time as a date night, without the kiddos. Either way, we plan on making this a usual neighborhood stop.

Simply amazing! Would give 6 stars if I could. 

Most all you can eat sushi places are middle of the road quality wise but NOT Hanabi. The fish is so fresh and tender it melts in your mouth. The variety and quality of rolls availabe will make even the most picky of diners happy. One thing we loved was how Hanabi doesn't skimp on the fish in their rolls the way many all you can eat places do. 

Big John and the owner Andy were the chefs for our visit and they were so friendly and accommodating. The entire staff for that matter were so genuine they made us feel like old friends. 

Make sure you try the Andy's roll and the Hanabi roll. And if big John or Andy are behind the counter ask them to make you something special thats not on the menu and prepare your taste buds for perfection. We had the house sake and it was on par with the delicious food. This is our new go-to place for sushi. 

Great sushi places are like great auto mechanics. Almost impossible to find! But we found one with Hanabi!  I can't wait to go back.

The food was delicious and the price was amazing, I would definitely come back here again ^.^ AYCE Sushi that you don't have to go to town to enjoy. Only 19.99 for dinner until the end of November 2016, check it out!
We go here all the time. Excellent food and very friendly staff , great service!!! Great price too!!! Anyone who loves sushi must go here!!!
Solid sushi place. I got the all you can eat lunch special for $20, and everything I ordered was good. In general, I was impressed with the quality. Atmosphere and service were both good too.

Just moved here from CA wanted to find a sushi restaurant near home. Ordered something simple to try them out. Rainbow roll, seaweed salad. It was bad. Took two bites of the roll, that was no where near a rainbow. I should have taken photo before I threw it out. All white fish except one piece had salmon and one piece tuna. It did not taste fresh like you would think, there was a black spot on one of the white fish pieces. The seaweed salad did not taste fresh either. So did not finish that. They seem like very nice people but just not the place for me.

Worst service we have ever experienced!!! Second worst sushi we have ever eaten! Normally we go to Zenshin or Oyshi! However it was my Moms birthday we decided to try something new... Biggest Mistake!!! 

We checked it out before bringing my mom, and met with the chef and owner ( who claimed he worked at yellowtail in the Bellagio and Nobu at Ceasars we love Nobu so decided thus was the place for moms birthday dinner! Bonus the Chef seemed very nice!

When we arrived 5 adults & 2 toddlers we were hungry and excited, however we met with the two worst servers!!! They were extremely rude, unfriendly, and lacked knowledge they also never checked on us after our first order ?? We had to leave our table three times to request food, drinks, and get this our check!!! Don't worry they didn't forget to charge us a 20% gratuity charge! 

After two hours of sitting we left hungry and spending just under $200.00 with no dessert for my mom or any of us!! Because although green tea cheesecake is on the menu the server said it was not available today they were sold out at 6pm and no business?! Okay make it up to us with some ice cream... 1/4 scoops with fingerprints actual finger prints!!!!  On our ice cream so disgusting!!!

Thankfully we went to cream at downtown summerlin after for taco Tuesday and as always they were great! And saved our day!

Strong 4 stars.

This might be my new west side sushi spot when I don't feel like driving across the strip to Sakana.

Pros:
-Small nigiri cuts, but also small rice portion...fair balance
-Halibut on the nigiri menu...YES!
-Shrimp appetizers done 3-4 different ways
-Overall good quality of fish
-They have a loyalty card where your 11th is free 
-Honey toast tasted better here than at Sakana and the ice cream wasn't rock hard
-Friendly owner, Andy, came to ask how everything was...also friendly servers

Cons: 
-I miss all the no rice sushi options that Jjanga and Sakana offer, they only had one on the menu and you can order it once as opposed to other places that give you 5-6 options to order (and I order them all)
-They had two specials written on the board of which you could have one of each...they were out of one, so I figured they'd make up for it by allowing me to order two of the other. Nope.
-Haven't found my favorite roll yet of the comparatively limited choices offered, but I'm a nigiri guy anyway...
-The raw oysters need a small dab of cocktail sauce or sirarcha or something for flavor ...someone else pointed this out in their review...gotta make that happen

Anyone moaning about the $28 price tag for dinner...if you do the math (and you like the place) it comes back into the $25-$26 AYCE dinner price range...completely in line with the rest of the AYCE sushi joints in Vegas.

Overall I walked out happy and I will return...

This place is going downhill. Small portions of fish on the sushi that are not cut right resulting in small chewy fish. Wasabi dried out and in no way fresh. All deep fried items taste like old oil. The only good thing are the waitresses. They are very pleasant and hard working despite their hovering manager.

We were told by trusted friends that this was the best place to eat Japanese foods, including sushi. We were warmly welcomed and promptly greeted upon entering.

The layout and design is very clean, simple and yet elegant. 

Now to the important stuff... The food! We were not disappointed and were extremely pleased with every item ordered. The quality was extremely fresh, the taste was great -better than expected for AYCE, the presentation was perfect. 

We sampled more than 24 dishes from their menu and they were all exquisite. There were not any favorites on the table because they were all great. I would like to note that the eel, salmon, mackerel, and yellowtail were all noticeably high quality and fresh - compared to other AYCE restaurants - the value here at their prices is well worth the money spent! 

As other reviewers stated - this place is phenomenal. 

Thank you to Andy who took the time to ensure that we enjoyed each of our dishes.

We were also thanked upon exiting.

My signature sushi dish is ikura with a quail egg on top. In all the years I have been enjoying sushi, I have never paid extra for a quail egg. This establishment charges $1.50 per quail egg which to me is totally unacceptable.. Although, the food was fresh, I will not be back and will enjoy my sushi at Sushi Kaya!
Very good sushi. The service is always awesome. They make my family always feel welcome.
Having AYCE dinner with my kids. Good food, great special price!  Presentation was very nice looking.  My son loved the green tea cheesecake.
Can you say Yummy? We did all you can eat and loved the variety that is offered. We will be back!

Excellent new sushi spot right around the corner from my house! how much better does it get than that? 

Tried the : Shrimp popper, Salmon Special, The Hanabi special, my absolute favorite roll was the Crispy rainbow i love the combination and sauce. 

I also tried the salmon poke and tuna poke i personally did not like the seaweed in the poke. 
 For dessert i tried the Honey Toast it was good, The bread was nice and chrispy but it's just hawaiian bread and vanilla ice cream with honey. 

Just a reminder fellow yelpers the umm 8.01 discount for Ayce has expired. Idk
if they just have not gotten around to taking that down or just smart business lol ;) Either way give Hanabi a shot!

Great sushi. And really open, fresh atmosphere. However, I won't be returning. The owner/chef came to our table about four times, interrupting our conversations. It was fine the first time but after that, it was distracting. Also, I've eaten at SEVERAL All You Can Eat sushi places and they've all been really chill if you have a few pieces of a roll left over. Not this place. We were told we'd have to pay if we didn't finish. Mind you, we only had about 6 pieces left. So my friends had to help me finish to avoid paying. Another thing: my friend and I ordered the same appetizer and the waitress asked me if I wanted to share with my friend and I told her no, I wanted my own. Maybe I'm sensitive but that bothered me. And she also kept forgetting to bring out some items we ordered, so we had to ask for them again. Overall it's a good place but I've been to other sushi restaurants and had a better experience.

I've been to this place before but it looks like it's owned by another. It's completely remodeled and I believe a new name. Is was years ago from a groupon. 

It's absolutely gorgeous and clean this sushi restaurant. I loved the way it was decorated and the seats were so comfy. I'm a culinary student so I pay great attention to cleanliness. When I was going to the restroom the kitchen looked organized and clean. They had an area for storage that was covered with a curtain but so organized. It looked like some of the sauces they used were stored in scholles, which great!!! Proper food safety handling. Nothing is ever contaminated by opening a bottle and closing bottles with bare hands. 

The sushi was super fresh and arrived quickly. I loved the salmon poke. It was my favorite. The price is also great. For lunch AYCE is $19.99. My boyfriend and I would drive a little ways to go to a place that's called Naka Sushi that offers it at the same price but this place is way better. They offer more for appetizers and the restaurant is so clean. Not only that Ashley the waitress is extremely tentative. Such good customer service. My tea was never out. She always refilled it. I highly recommend this restaurant. You will love it.
The sushi was average, I also felt the list of rolls was much smaller than other sushi places ive eaten at. Nothing really stuck out here to me, but it was a pleasant experience.
This food is prepared with an extreme love for quality and perfection. Chef Andy is discerning beyond words about the experience of good eating. A pleasure to be in such great hands.

First Review from 2016 (5stars): I took my parents here with a Groupon deal they had. It is conveniently located next to the movie theater. Pretty and modern deco inside gives you a clean feeling. Food was delicious and fresh, service was nice and quick. We didn't do the AYCE, and the price was decent with the groupon offer. Definitely recommend the AYCE, it actually includes plain sashimi, not just sushi. 

Updated Review: Girls Day out, four of us decided to go out to lunch together. It is hard for us to gather, not to mention on a week day. We manage to do it today and I recommended we come here. What a total disappointment! Other than the server lady was super nice, I really don't have anything good to say. We ordered two AYCE lunch and two AYCE dinner; extra ten bucks of dinner AYCE got us extra four pieces of uni and four pieces of Yellowtail sashimi. Please see the attached images for the portion. Ten dollar difference. Rice was falling apart on all sushi ordered, no fragrance and not sticky. We couldn't even pick it up without it falling all over the plate and table. Wasabi was like a green flour paste with no spice to it. We started trying plain wasabi and not even spicy, all four of us was surprised. My girlfriends all complained the small fish portion on all sushi rolls ordered as well. Wow! What happened Hanabi??

Wonderful sushi restaurant! Andy makes incredible tonkatsu miso ramen. We've been treated with chef specials that have been delicious. Each time we've been, we've been greeted warmly and treated like family. It's a great feeling to be remembered as a patron. This is our favorite sushi haunt.

Been here 3 times to check for consistency and I've found it. The wait staff are very polite and helpful in telling about each roll or about their specials. I really like the benches they have as tables, like an old camping table on a hiking trail. It's funny!. The food itself is pretty fresh, and the wait isn't too long from ordering to receiving. They are also pretty hidden, I literally stumbled across them by sheer coincidence a couple weeks ago and had to search yelp for over an hour to find the restaurant. Hidden gem? Definitely! The 1 bad mark I have is that this last time I came in, they were actually very slow, so we had multiple waiters dealing with us, so we would order from 1 person, he would leave, and 30 seconds later another guy came up asking if we needed anything else. But they didn't talk to each other. We put in 1 order, and both waiters brought us that roll. It was funny, but was also mildly annoying. I won't let it stand in the way of coming back though. I will definitely return, they are just too good!
I had the Superman and Crispy rice something sushi last night... I've been on the commode off and on since 6 a.m. and I am having really bad stomach cramps.

One of the best all u can eat sushi restaurant in town. Food taste was really good and fresh. So many variety  of selections from sushi bar and kitchen.
All of staff was well trained with polite manner.
I personally love Japanese food. And me n my wife always interesting to try new restaurants.


This restaurant is something different from a common all u can eat sushi restaurant in neighborhood  u feel like u r in one of modern Japanese restaurant in strip. Very good atmosphere~~

I strongly recommend this hot new spot to person who want try fine dining experience in ur neighborhood!!!

Very fresh fish. The rolls or not overloaded with rice like some all you can eat places. 

Do you oysters are incredible and I highly recommend them. Service was Attentive. 

The discount for checking in on y'all nautical theme I think is the same price.

BEWARE!!! Had high hopes for this place. Ordered a couple rolls. My wife took her first bite of her roll, looked down and saw a COCKROACH crawl from underneath her plate. They offered to make us a new roll. We agreed, they brought out the same partially eaten roll, no lie. And gave us two tiny little pieces of sushi to compensate. The owner was apologetic but did not offer a comped meal and ultimately charged us full price for ROACH INFESTED Dinning experience. 808 Sushi Tapas was the place before this one and kills there sushi. We will not be back to this place...

Ok, this place is fine and the sashimi was very good, we had a 20 piece plate. They have a regular menu an I suspect their claim to fame is lunch with a Bento Box, sushi rolls or an all you can eat venue... this would certainly live up to the 4.5 from Yelp. For us, It was just not a dining experience.

I'm a big sushi person and at my first time eating at Hanabi I had one of the best All You Can Eat Sushi experience I've ever had. The staff and chef were all very attentive and quick. Chef Andy came out and introduced himself personally which I really appreciated. The sushi was spectacular, the design was beautiful, and I know for certain I'll be back in no time.

10/10 Very good! Definitely a favorite that we will visit again and again. We're satisfied and content from appetizer to dessert! Service is quick and attentive! Best and fastest service sushi place we've been to in Vegas. The soft shell crab is a must try and the Coco Salmon too. The atmosphere is great and not too formal, nice and personal!

Ate here this afternoon with my family after walking out of another sushi spot for service/ cleanliness issues. I remembered this place from coming once before with a friend. We were starving so we ordered quite a few rolls to start off. The service was really good and the food was even better!! Every roll was Amazeballs and their appetizers really creative and good. I got the dynamite nachos or the volcano nachos? Something like that the name is not important just know any nacho/sushi hybrid is bound to be amazing! I also really liked that that their kids meals come with so much!! My kids got miso soup, and appetizer and their own roll. Plenty of food and they liked it all.

I ordered a few rolls for delivery.  

Pros:
Good quality of fish

Cons:
They didn't put sauce on the sunset roll like I was anticipating- not sure if it's because it was delivered, but assumed they'd put it on the side if needed for transport.

Didn't order anything that "wow'd" us, but would be willing to order again and would probably have better luck at the restaurant.

I have been to more sushi places around town than I am willing to admit. But, this place takes the cake. Our meal last night was so good, especially the Animal Style roll and the lobster tempura roll. Really, you can't go wrong with anything here. The food quality is great, and the service is even better. AYCE prices are a tad higher than average but that is because their food is way above average! Spend the extra few bucks for good food and a nice atmosphere here.
Very nice setup. Clean. Music played at reasonable volume. Friendly staff. Sushi prepared very well and great taste! Love how many different rolls there are to choose from! Will definitely go back.
This is now our new favorite AYCE sushi in town!  Good selection, sushi chefs are super friendly and accommodating and the owner very welcoming!  Highly recommended!

Great little sushi spot 
Took advantage of all you can eat to sample lots of different types of fish 
Friendly  staff 
Great variety of items on the menu 
A must try
Ordered delivery. It was late. The guy got lost  and seemed high. I asked for soy paper and they gave me seaweed. Gross. Never again.
Good neighborhood sushi place - good value, delicious sushi.  IMO, there's not many good sushi places near Summerlin; so this give me a new go-to.
Great sushi, great service and the atmosphere was cute and lively.  Our orders came out so fast and prompt! Definitely coming back!

I ordered delivery from Hanabi through Yelp; I've never been to the restaurant.

Generally, I don't think that sushi lends itself well to grocery stores or delivery. Take out is only minimally better. Sushi is not just about the food, it's about the experience.

I also learned to appreciate sushi in Japan, where I lived for 17 years. It follows that I'm unfamiliar with what has become sushi in America. All the different rolls, the decidedly un-sushi flavors, like jalapeÃ±o, confuse me! So we only ordered traditional nigiri, no rolls or specialties.

That said, one expects a restaurant to do its best to overcome the inherent difficulties in offering sushi for delivery. Presentation is important, maybe not for showy spider rolls, but for traditional sushi. Ours arrived in typical styro boxes, with no garnish or decoration, no eye to arrangement. Our order looked so unappetizing, I was tempted to throw the whole thing away.

So, on to the actual product. Sushi is not about fish. Although fish plays an important role, undeniably, there are many varieties of sushi that have no fish at all. Sushi is about the rice. It should be very sticky, slightly sweet, shiny, and just about room temperature; neither too hot nor too cool.

The rice that Hanabi served seemed to be nothing more than steamed white rice. It had no cohesion, so the pieces were difficult to pick up. Chopsticks, fork, and bare hands were equally ineffective. And the rice was tasteless.

Any "itamae" worth his ginger will tell you that he spent upwards of ten years perfecting his knife skills, and still practices regularly. The slivers of fish we received were poorly cut with ragged edges that made us wonder if the chef's knife maybe needed sharpening. I am by no means a sushi chef, but I could probably have done better with a sharp chef's knife.

Finally, the order came out wrong. Sushi I ordered wasn't there, and sushi I didn't order was.

For the price, which was not in the realm of "inexpensive," this restaurant disappointed with its delivery. But I must again state that this review is for delivery only, and in-house quality may be vastly different. Based on the other reviews here, I may visit the restaurant, but I won't be ordering delivery from them again.

Came here and got a few rolls, jalapeno poppers, and udon. Was expecting it to be much better. Ordered it to go and after a few bites at home we threw pretty much all the sushi away. We've had sushi in many states and a few countries and this was by far the worst we've ever had. Disappointing. Customer service was good though...

New local sushi place.  Been here twice and it is easily the best All You Can Eat sushi place that I have found in Vegas!  Tons of options, both sushi and regular menu items.  The fish is very fresh and they show pride in their product!  The staff is really attentive and work well as a team to provide good service!

As a side note, we really loved the crab salad that they use for their California Rolls!

Highly highly recommended!

Good sushi; I had the all you can eat lunch, which has a pretty good selection. The salmon, scallop, and white tuna stood out most, taste-wise. Service was a little slow. Dinner has a few more items available, so I hope to try that sometime.
This is definitely the best sushi spot in Las Vegas . Service is superb and the food is incredible. I highly recommend this place to everyone! Prices are great too.

So this is now my official go to for a Sushi spot.  They have great appetitzers.  The garlic tuna is sooooo good!! Gotta try the crispy shrimp... not the tempura shrimp but the crispy shrimp.  It has the cream cheese inside. Their oysters are fresh.
Yum-yum-yum! Great! Great! Great! Food is fresh and tasty, stuff is super friendly! Definitely recommend this place and for sure will come back!

I just moved in the area and I was in the mood for some good sushi. The menu had so much to pick from but I ended up getting the "911" it was soooooo good. I have never had sushi that tasted that fresh before. I also saw that they had all you can eat specials, which is cool. I will most def be a regular :-) 
.... Went for the all you can eat special for the first time and it was amazing. The chefs were very entertaining and my new favorite one is "Burn My House" You can't beat all you can eat for 20 bucks!

Best sushi in town!
It's Brand new and so worth a try. 
The chef special rolls are awesome, the service is great (thanks Sara) and fantastic combinations keep coming...
We will be back soon!

We used to come here all the time until one day my husband noticed some sanitary issues happening in the kitchen while we were sitting at the bar with direct view.  With gloves not being changed and such we stopped coming. Too bad really the food was great, but with raw fish involved we don't want to get sick.
If I could give zero stars I would! Came in 45 minutes before closing and they denied us because they were closing in 45 minutes.!!!!!!

First time in this place. Went during their lunch service, and the taste of the food was fantastic. The staff was polite and highly attentive. I like the atmosphere of the restaurant. Definitely coming here again!

Please thank your head server for telling us to sit far away at a table far away from everyone because according to her our 2yo twin boys are loud. We had just walked in for 20 seconds! 
Her actions made it possible to have an excellent dinner at Bachi Burger. 

We have been there three previous times with the worst sounds made being the little soy sauce dishes being tossed on the floor. 
We were seated at the last table in the restaurant closest to the restrooms at the time. The same person sat us that time as well. She is a shorter Asian woman with glasses. 
Our boys are not children who cry throughout dinner, in fact they do not cry at all when they are out eating. Because they love food!
They are the type who flirt with the other very friendly tall server and wave at the man who brought our iced teas. 
You lost repeat customers who will take every chance that we get to make sure everyone knows what kind of a person you choose to employ.
 Very rude and poor customer service! I have never had heard anyone works in service industry would talk to customer like that.

This place is great! I am overly cautious of sushi places because of the raw fish but this place is clean and the sushi is excellent. It's a small place and is decorated in true minimalist fashion. The service was excellent and the prices are competitive with other AYCE places. The plum ice cream is excellent and not too sweet. The only thing is that if you need a place to sit with back support or are not fond of hard benches then you'll have to sit at the sushi bar. Definitely coming back.

The best AYCE sushi experience I've had, ever. They have all the great rolls you'd expect, plus some lesser known ones for variety. They do not skimp on the fish- all portions are very generous. They do not overload on rice either.

But what really sets them apart is their delicious and wide variety of kitchen items. I don't know how much work it is to maintain such high quality food of so many kinds, but they do it so well. Try the pork belly- in addition to being so tender and delicious, it comes with mango slaw which was just incredible. We also had octopus skewers which was fun, and the daily special was a citrus fish which was also great (in addition to tons and tons of sushi rolls).

The service was fantastic- we had a friendly and attentive male server who gave us good advice and was super prompt. The lady who seemed like the owner always had a smile. Everyone was really nice.

Protip: we came here 3 PM on a Saturday- great time to get AYCE service as we were the only ones in the restaurant.

We will definitely come straight back here for our AYCE fix. It was also really reasonably priced at $25/person for dinner and in my opinion offered way more than the standard AYCE sushi experience

Came here for dinner the other night and it was great! Fresh fish, fast service, and hot sake! It's pretty good pricing (one of the cheaper AYCE in town) and really good rolls. The only thing that was a little weird is they put asparagus in a lot of their rolls. Not bad, just different. Overall great experience and I'll definitely be back.

Got the all you can eat and it was amazing. They brought everything out right away and were constantly available to ask for more. Food tasted fantastic and service was excellent. Everyone there was very friendly. Definitely recommend. Will be back here soon.

I always love the yelp reviews and I have gained a lot of trust over the years of using Yelp service, for the first time I am doubting the yelp service and reviewers in Las Vegas.

** Important ** Before I give my reviews, I must say sushi or sashimi (i.e. raw fish) is something we have not tried. We just could not have them, because my wife was pregnant.

Ambience
Nice and clean restaurant with a lot of screens, maybe little too many.
****

Service
Generally pay attention to our table good. We were in at 3pm so with very few tables to serve, that is expected, but still nice. However, I was shock with what server said. One of the food that we ordered was Cold Soba, after 5 minutes, the server comes back and says "sorry we are short on cold soup so we will not be able to make Cold Soba" this was something that my wife really wanted or the baby inside really wanted lol she then continued by saying "the one on desert inn is good for this" To me it sounded like "no one order those and you should go to that one, if you want Cold Soba" Just sounded very rude.
**

Food
We ordered Cold Soba, Japanese Hamburger Steak and Baked Salmon Roll.
As I mentioned above we ordered Cold Soba, but it wasn't available so we cancelled the order. Japanese Hamburger Steak, we ordered well-done because of pregnant wife. The food came out burnt on the outside and very salty. What does this mean? Instead of cooking in the medium heat for more well-done inside and not burnt outside, they cooked in full flame. Salty means, they just cooked it for longer period of time to get it more cooked without changing any level of sodium or adding water. Hence mushroom and onion that were with the meat was also salty.
Baked Salmon Roll had some more expensive ingredients in it, such as cream cheese, salmon and some more cheese on top, but again they could not balanced the flavours.
Other side dishes were not best either. Wasabi was pretty low quality or was not stored in right temperature. Iced green tea was green coloured iced water instead of tasting green tea. Salad was fresh, but too much dressing.
Overall, the food here is a kind of food that you would find in a mall food court, no expertise or love in cooking.
*

Price
Japanese Hamburger Steak should be sufficient for $4
Baked Salmon Roll should be sufficient for $6 just because there are some higher priced ingredient in it.
So total bill with tip should have been about $14, but instead the bill was over $30
